Reviews.Title: “I'm Glad We Booked It!”
Reviews.Author: Audrey667
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Palm Gallery Hotel in Rome in March 2012 and we're so glad we did. I booked it based on the reviews I'd read about on Tripadvisor and it definitely lived up to expectations. Luisa, its owner, is lovely. She is kind and thoughtful, very easy-going, very helpful and genuine. A good person. Before I booked the hotel, I asked a lot of questions and Luisa also answered my emails promptly and gave good advice. Her team , among them Vincenzo, Daniel, and Lorenzo were equally helpful. Like Luisa, they answered all our questions about where to go in Rome & how to get there with interest and patience. The hotel even provides a handout giving a list of restaurants you can find close by and our group of five found this truly useful. They also give a handout listing the tourist attractions in Rome and telling you the buses you can take to get there, and we travelled everywhere with that list. Palm Gallery also provides breakfast and the variety of food we got was great - several types of juices, bread, cheese, croissants, ham, a variety of jams, danish, and excellent coffee and cappucino. There's also eggs - any way you want them cooked. We went in early spring and the weather was often good enough to have breakfast outside in the outdoor patio. A leisurely breakfast with the sun streaming down - wonderful! The hotel is in an excellent location. It's in a quiet neighbourhood with easy access to the city. The bus stop is nearby (about five minutes' walk) and so is the metro and so it was very easy to go places. The rooms in Palm Gallery are thoughtfully decorated and very clean and it was always a pleasure, after a long day of sight-seeing and walking, to arrive back at the hotel and our rooms. If I'm ever asked about accommodation in Rome, the Palm Gallery is the hotel I'm going to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit”
Reviews.Author: Mabel12345
Reviews.Content: I visited The Palm Gallery in November and wrote a review and said it was so good I would go back, I did just that in March 2012. It was another fantastic trip. The welcome at Palm Gallery is exceptional. We stayed in the same room as last time and there were 3 of us this time and there was ample room with 3 beds. Again the room was spotless and the decoration very tasteful in cream, none of the red and gold bling that I have heard about in Rome. For more details please see my previous review but I wanted people to know that I did return as the hotel is warm, friendly and very child friendly. I didnt have children with me but another family did and the owner bought a cake out on the little boys birthday and we all sang Happy Birthday on the lovely sunny terrace. That terrace will stay with me for a long time. We have been lucky with the weather on both our trips, warm sun all the way. Trevi Fountain my favourite, and this time we spent an afternoon in Villa Borghese which was beautiful and very relaxing. Louisa and her staff were as welcoming this time as the last and again I say, I will be returning to Rome and The Palm Gallery .

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding comfort”
Reviews.Author: Karuna C
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Palm Gallery Hotel recently and it measured up to all the great reviews I had read online! The location in Rome is fantastic, in a beautiful neighborhood away from the crowds and very well connected to the city. Rooms also beat our expectations - the little smoking room is a lovely little treat! The proprietor, Luisa, and staff were extremely personable and went out of their way to provide us directions, reviews, reservations, travel tips etc. For two girls travelling alone it was a very safe and welcoming environment - it was the true Italian hospitality I've always heard about. Also very impressed by the quality and variety of foods for breakfast and the wine list (which we enjoyed in the outdoor patio in the evenings). Definitely a great find!! KC

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Exceptional Service, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-week vacation in Europe, which included a 5-night stay at the Palm Gallery Hotel. We would recommend this charming B&B hotel to anyone planning a trip to Rome. You will fall in love with the owner, Luisa, who is gracious, kind, and ever so thoughtful. Her amazing staff, Lorenzo, Vincenzo, and Amir assisted us with breakfast at the hotel, restaurant reservations, directions to local stores, transportation services, and so much more. The hotel is located in a beautiful and picturesque residential neighborhood. Our room was spacious, very clean, and nicely decorated. The front patio is a great place to relax any time of the day ... enjoy a cup of espresso... a glass of wine and cheese from a local market... or just unwind taking in the beauty of the local landscape and architecture. During our visit, we found it most convenient to use the metro to travel around the city. We also enjoyed exploring Rome by foot, adding 5-10 miles of exercise to our daily routine, allowing us to indulge in delicious Italian meals and, of course, Gelati ice cream. Within walking distance of the hotel, you’ll find beautiful parks, local bus stops, the metro, grocery stores, and restaurants. Day trips to Florence and Naples are possible, thanks to Italy's express train - 2 hours from Rome to Florence. We took the metro to the Termini, then boarded an 8am train to Florence and returned that evening on the 7pm train. Martin & Elizabeth (California)

Reviews.Title: “Can't do better than this”
Reviews.Author: threed415
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights and found it delightful. The owner, Luisa, couldn't have been more gracious and she was quite helpful in offering ideas for eating places and site-seeing. The facilities couldn't have been cleaner nor more modern, and yet the feel was still of old Italy. The staff was great too. Just far enough from the center of Rome to allow a relaxed feeling, but yet only a 15-minute bus ride from the main train station on bus #90. Very safe neighborhood. THIS is a gem of a place. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Palm Gallery to anyone. Our rooms were absolutely beautiful and their staff was incredibly charming and helpful. We can't thank them enough for many times going out of their way to be accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Palm Gallery”
Reviews.Author: ftmnc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Palm Gallery. It is a wonderful B & B. The rooms are large, beautifully decorated, extremely clean. The bathrooms are wonderful, especially for European standards at this price. Service and friendliness of the owners and staff is perfect. They have a wonderful patio/deck to enjoy a drink at the beginning or end of the day. They are about ready to open a beautiful new breakfast room which will make this hotel just about perfect. The only thing you need to know about this hotel is that it is in a very upscale residential area. That means that you will need to take a taxi to dinner at night. This is not a problem because they will call one for you and it arrives within minutes. The plus side to the location is that it is beautiful, peaceful and a wonderful place to come at the end of the day to escape the craziness of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service”
Reviews.Author: JamesRidge
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Palm Gallery. The room was large and spotless, the breakfast very good. But the stay was made by the superb service. Everyone went out of their way to ensure you had a great stay. Luisa in particular was extremely helpful, even getting up at 4AM the morning we left (in spite of our protestations) see us off and make us coffee. On arrival you get a map, transit instructions, best places to eat, drink and snack in the various regions or Rome, and best of all a map and listing of the local restaurants. The hotel is a short taxi or transit ride from the centre of Rome, but the upside is that the restaurants in the area are for locals only and are very very good. We went to Osteria dell'Arco twice and it is one of the best restaurants we have been to in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GBTP
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our 10 year old daughter and everyone welcomed us very warmly. Luisa printed pictures off her PC for my daughter to colour in, providing pens and pencils too. My daughter felt very safe and comfortable here and happily nipped downstairs from our room to say hi to Luisa or Daniel. Breakfast was more than adequate and if you had pre or post dinner drinks they always came with some very tasty nibbles at no charge. Although a bit further from the centre it was a lovely walk into the centre in the morning but there was also an excellent bus service should you prefer. Luisa recommended some excellent restaurants during our 5 night stay and was extremely helpful if you had any type of query. My daughter really liked Daniel too, who like Luisa could not have been more helpful. We had arranged for Daniel to collect us from the airport and he was there waiting for us and pleasantly chatted as we travelled from the airport to the hotel. The hotel was very comfortable, our room was light and airy and most important for my husband, very peaceful at night so an excellent sleep experienced. Overall, extremely friendly and i would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone planning a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home....”
Reviews.Author: Joan006_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palm Gallery hotel this Feb '12. It's great choice for anyone who enjoys the feeling of staying at a 'boutique hotel' while having the warmth of home. Each room has been decorated with its own unique style, comfort and elegance. The rooms are clean and have ample sunlight which can be easily blocked out for a good night's rest. Being located in a residential neighborhood, you can enjoy the peace and quiet. Accessing public transportation (bus/tram/train) is easy as it is all within walking distance. The breakfast being served is more than adequate. Luisa (hotel owner) is an amazing person that takes interest in making her guests feel right at home and goes out her way to do it. She has a wonderful, amazing and efficient staff (Daniel, Vincenzo, Toni and Lorenzo) that made it easy getting around in Rome and have a wonderful stay at the hotel. I look forward to staying there again on my next trip to Rome. Jean & Joan (Kuwait)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: HighFlyerNJ
Reviews.Content: Palm Gallery Hotel is a great choice for anyone visiting Rome. The hotel is located in a very quiet neighborhood away from the crowds of tourists. We slept with the windows open each night we were there and were not disturbed at all. The rooms are very clean and give you the feeling of a private home rather than staying in a hotel. The staff is excellent and they were very accommodating. They assisted with transportation and recommendations for restaurants. We also booked the bus transfer to the airport on our last day. When I booked the hotel, I was concerned about the distance from all the sights and the need to rely on buses and the metro to get around. I can honestly say that we did not have any major problems using the busses or trains; we got everywhere we needed to and saw everything on our list. Anyone who has used mass transit in a large city will not have any issues getting to/from the sights downtown. There is a newspaper stand located adjacent to the 62 bus route which sells bus passes. The bus stop is located a brief 3-5 minute walk from the hotel and the metro is about 10-15 minutes. A couple things we noticed about the mass transit, in the morning the bus can be very crowded with workers heading downtown, between 8-10am all the busses we saw/rode were very crowded. In the evening, the busses were crowded during the usual rush hour 4-6pm, but later in the evening there was no issue. One day we decided to take the metro train and upon arrival at the station we found that the crews were on strike. We were unaware of the strike and apparently everyone waiting to get into the station was also unaware. We took a cab to the main train station which cost 10 euro. The metro did begin running again around 3pm in the afternoon. One day we walked from the Spanish Steps back to the hotel, the walk was not horrible but we probably should not have attempted it after walking around all day. It took us close to 45 minutes to get back. If you are going to walk to the steps, start out in the morning and then take the bus/train back in the afternoon when you are tired. There is a lot of walking in Rome, we did over 6 miles in one day. If you decide to try and get a cab from the hotel to the downtown area it will cost you anywhere from 10-15 euro. Try to have exact change or smaller bills on you, as communication and making change can sometime be difficult. The Palm Gallery is a great choice and should be considered by anyone heading to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Julian F
Reviews.Content: Our welcome was warm. The room was beautiful, tastefully furnished, comfortable beds. The house and neighbourhood were very quiet and we did not have any noise issues

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else - Best Service”
Reviews.Author: adelone9
Reviews.Content: The staff and service at the hotel is far and away the best that I have ever experienced. We arrived around 11 am and we were greeted by a member of the staff. He took our luggage and served us cappuccinos while we relaxed and planned out our first day in Rome. The staff even hurried up to clean our room so that we could get into it before heading into the city. Throughout our entire stay, the staff continuously went above and beyond the call of duty to accommodate us. We happened to be there on New Years Eve and the owner (Luisa) gave every guest a bottle of sparkling Italian wine and pieces of a traditional Italian New Years Cake. She even invited us up onto the roof for an amazing view of the fireworks while we ate cake, drank wine and rang in the new year. She acted as though we were friends of hers that were visiting rather than guests of the hotel. They have a fantastic (and free) breakfast buffet that includes made to order omelets. The room was nice and a decent size for a European hotel. There is free internet access. Although it is not in the center of Rome, it was nice to be away from all the noise and people. Plus, it was easy to get into the main part of the city via bus or metro (and the staff was glad to help us find the right bus). I won't even consider staying anywhere else the next time that I go back to Rome. Thanks for a great experience Luisa!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, neat but a little expensive...”
Reviews.Author: Serbese
Reviews.Content: We stayed in many hotels in Italy and this was by far the most expensive one. We asked for a big room and paid 20€ extra for it. It worked out to be a good idea since we stayed here for 3 days. The lobby, reception and the dining room is very tiny however very efficient. The rooms had high ceilings and they were very clean. We parked our car right in front of the hotel for the whole stay. The staff were all helpful and smiling. There were very little to complain about this hotel. One was the towels in our room were all like sand papers but clean. When I tried to tell the owner and she said she deliberately made them to be rock hard for health reasons. The other was the toilet didn't stop flushing and there were constant water flow if you forgot to tap it for the second time. I wouldn't normally write this sort of things on my reviews however the owner seemed to be happy with the way the toilet worked when I told her. So I guess you should now beforehand because the owner seems to think nothing is needed to be done to fix this. Overall this boutique hotel is a good stay, good breakfast, friendly staff and in a relaxing quite neighborhood. I would consider it very good but not excellent.

Reviews.Title: “value”
Reviews.Author: mark h
Reviews.Content: Hi all, my experience of the Palm Gallery Hotel was very good 1) The staff are very helpfull & knowledegable and will help you with, train and bus times, attractions worth visiting, retaruants,and pricing for all the above. 2) It is clean and simple, but nicely decorated and modern with all the needed facilities including a smoking room. 3) comfortable. 4) About a twenty minute walk from the Spanish steps, where you can take part in the New Rome Free tour, well worth doing,, and 2 minutes from a bus stop which will take you anywhere you want to go and about 10 minutes from a selection of resteruants. 5) Did not bother me but the hotel has several cats.6) We were made to feel really welcome and the staff bent over backwards to help. 7) Value for money, I thought very reasonably priced, I think it was about 440 euro for one 3 bed room for 3 nights, but we got a special deal. 8) To finish the best praise I can give it is if I were to go to Rome again I would not look anywhere else I would immediatley book there.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for...and more”
Reviews.Author: Jenny M
Reviews.Content: The Palm Gallery Hotel was just what I was looking for in Rome - small, charming, very friendly and incredibly good value. Luisa was all about providing the best service available and she and her staff could not have been more helpful or accommodating. Our welcome was warm and inviting which set the pace for our short 2 night stay. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to the very large 'panoramica' room with the 2 corner windows. I guess the view outside wasn't quite as beautiful as I had imagined but it was winter and still very nice. The room was stunning - clean, spacious and the bed was so comfortable. Loved the bathroom and the only gripe was that the towels were a little old looking and scratchy (just needed drying in the tumble dryer). Two of the breakfast highlights were the cappuccinos made with fresh milk from cows in the neighbouring mountains and the freshly squeezed orange juice. Luisa recommended a wonderful little Italian restaurant close by for dinner and it was so much better than the ones we tried in the centre of Rome. We felt welcome and were treated like one of the locals. Great wine selection too. The house and neighbourhood were very quiet and we did not have any noise issues whatsoever even though the villa is still being renovated. I love her style, energy and enthusiasm and will heartily recommend the hotel, especially in the low season, when we hope to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, welcoming , perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mabel12345
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome with my niece in November 2011. It was a first trip there for both of us. From the minute we were picked up by the hotel transport ( definitely worth it as hotel outside centre of Rome) the experience was fantastic. The driver pointed out some of the sights on the drive and the weather was warm and sunny. The hotel is a converted house, I noticed a previous review stating that they could hear noise through the thin walls, we didn't have that problem. We had a very early flight out of Gatwick and therefore arrived early but we were allowed into room. Daniel greeted us and couldn't have been more helpful. He offered to cook us breakfast or said we could help ourselves, choice of break toast, jams etc. The room was beautiful, tastefully furnished, comfortable beds. The room was light with 2 huge window looking out onto the quiet street. It was incredibly relaxing and after a busy few days in Rome you need to come back to a peaceful haven. Daniel, member of staff, gave us all the info we needed, bus routes, best hotels to eat etc and told us which buses to catch and where to catch them. He really couldn't have been more charming and helpful. We were straight off into Rome, the most beautiful city I have ever been to. There are many restaurants in central Rome but after getting the bus back to the Palm Gallery we just wanted to go somewhere close and within walking distance. As it is a residential area it is so quiet which was just what we wanted but luckily there are a lot of family run restaurants within 5-10 mins walking distance, no tourists, just Italian families which we loved ( check the list that the hotel give you as we went to a very expensive fish restaurant on the first night and all we wanted was a plate of pasta, although it was a nice place). When we got back from all our walking on the first night, and it was dark and we were exhausted, Louisa, the owner was at the front door to greet us. She was welcoming and asked us about our day and offered us a glass of wine on the terrace. The small terrace ( where we had breakfast each morning) was beautiful, surrrounded by fruit trees and sheltered from the breeze, we found so much time had gone into making the hotel into a totally relaxing experience. Vincenzo and Daniel were a real joy, they couldn't have been more friendly and helpful and caring, I have never been on a holiday where I didn't want to leave but I really didn't. I loved Rome, I loved The Palm Gallery and hopefully we will be back in the Spring. Thank you so much to all of you. It was the perfect weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: Mercano
Reviews.Content: Many wonderful reviews on this site. So here is my review. A bit out of the way. We chose to use the subway as the bus is a little adventurous for a short stay. About 20 min. walk to the subway station. A bit weary on the final walk home after walking around Rome all day. All the restaurants around are local place and by that I mean non-tourist hours. So if you arrive in the afternoon nothing will be open until 7:30 - 8:00PM, as in Rome, you know the rest. Hotel is a renovated house. Rooms are very well done with nice classic furniture and a comfortable bed. Bathroom is clean, stylish, working towel radiator, gleaming and charming. Walls are thin. Door has padding on it presumably to block noise, but doesn't make a difference. You can literally join in the conversation of the neighboring room and hopefully they didn't hear us when our jet lag woke us at 3AM. Only English channel available was the BBC news, not an uncommon experience in Europe. Service was excellent. Breakfast was good. Nice meet and greet with good tourist information, good map reading skills are required. It was a luxury guesthouse experience, old style backpackers will know what I mean, at 20 times the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - you are made so welcome”
Reviews.Author: settlervic
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving in Rome, I had conversed with Luisa on numerous questions via email and she was always extremely responsive and helpful. She even helped me organise a restaurant on New Year's eve - the day we arrived in Rome. On arrival, she greeted us warmly and organised some snacks and coffee as she gave us tons of information on what to do and see in Rome, and how to get around the city. This was such a wonderful welcome that made us completely at ease - this being our first time in Rome. That night, after dinner, she organised champagne and nibblies on the terrace rooftop as we celebrated the new year. Every morning, she lays out a great breakfast that includes cereals, freshly baked bread and pastries, cooked eggs any way you like, coffee, juice, etc. This in many ways is so much better than nearly 80% of all hotels I have stayed in. For the new year's day breakfast, she even cooked up some special local italian dishes as our brunch. All in all great amazing, home cooked food for us all! The hotel is very conveniently located just outside the city centre, plenty of good restaurants, a small supermarket nearby for groceries, and close to all types of buses. It is in a nice and safe residential neighbourhood, so gives you a nice feeling of living like a local. The hotel itself is very safe, we left our laptops out on the desk all day while we were out. There is an in room safe which we kept our passports and valuables in. I cannot recommend this place highly enough - it is very good value for money and much better than a cramped European hotel room. With the included cooked breakfast, and wonderful staff, what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very good rooms”
Reviews.Author: AndreKischinevsky
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent. People at hotel were of amazing help. Our luggage was lost by TAP and people at the hotel were very helpful at all times. Room is really nice. At arrivel, we were served complimentary snacks because we were hungry. The only drawback is that hotel is not close to Colosseum and Trevi, but overall it is a great choice for it´s price, quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience made with love!”
Reviews.Author: Allyson P
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine a more divine, elegant, warm experience for my first trip to Rome, Italy, and Europe! If they had a million stars I would give it to this hotel. Luisa, Daniel, Lorenzo, Vincenzo, and others (all the men working at the hotel) thank you for an amazing experience. This woman knows her stuff! They will graciously give you anything in their ability you ask for and recommend exactly what you are looking for! Thank you and will see you again soon! Buon Natale!

Reviews.Title: “Feel like Home”
Reviews.Author: Simon D
Reviews.Content: We've been there 6 months ago, and i would choose this place again without an hesitation. Very Good Value. A little out of the center (just enough) in a very nice and peacefull area, but still with a very fast access to it. The Welcome is perfect.....they make you feel at home right away. Couldn't make a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home but better”
Reviews.Author: bibakoop
Reviews.Content: After not seeing my husband for 4 months we met in Rome with our 2 year old and stayed at Palm Gallery Hotel. This place was just perfect. Luisa and Mincinzo (please excuse my spelling) were so lovely to us. We really wanted somewhere we could feel comfortable but not a standard hotel room. Everything about Palm Gallery was FABULOUS. When we arrived we were welcomed with Vino and nibbles which just set the scene and made us relaxed instantly (even with a 2 year old). While Palm Gallery is not in the very centre of Rome we loved the location and it really was a nice walk to all the sites (and quite ok for us even with little one) and we loved that we were away from that at the end of the day and in a lovely part of Rome. We just wanted to relax and enjoy Rome and Palm Gallery set the scene for a wonderful stay. The rooms are lovely as well with everything one needs and more. Breakfast was amazing. Everything was just perfect. We were so happy staying here. We would love to stay again and thank you for making our trip so perfect.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: Kim T
Reviews.Content: This place is truly unique and one of the most lovely hotel experiences I have ever had. The Palm Gallery was by far the favorite of our entire trip. Luisa and her staff are absolutely amazing. They are kind (the best service. ever), accommodating, and make one heck of a cappuccino! Other reviews mentioned the distance from the city center as a disadvantage, but we found the location to be an asset. The neighborhood is quiet, beautiful, and is home to the best dining experience we had in Rome...Osteria dell'Arco, which was recommended by the hotel. The walk into the city center doesn't take long and all the walking makes it that much easier to justify that second (or third!?) gelato. If walking isn't your thing, easy access to the bus and metro await you down the street. The next time we're in Rome we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere but here.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Aeromotive
Reviews.Content: When planning 2 months in advance for our Italy trip I was surprised to find the #7 hotel still had availabilities. Pros : 1) Service : it's undeniable that service is one of the greatest you can find. You're provided with maps, explanations, tips, and everything else you could need to explore Rome. 2) Rooms : clean, renovated and very spacious 3) Location : away from the touristy places of Rome, in a quiet residential area 4) Gardens : very nice exterior setting with tables and couches to relax with a snack and a drink. 5) Staff : extremely helpful and always courteous. A special hi to Daniel with whom we had a great conversation on our return to the airport! 6) Breakfast : Various, fresh and abundant! The best breakfast we had on our trip. 7) Price : Price was unbeatable for the service we got! Cons : 1) Location : yes, it can be a con too! Sometimes it was a pain to know that you're 30 minutes away from your hotel, but all was forgotten when you got to the comfort of the hotel. 2) Noisy rooms : Walls were not very well insulated (I guess that's normal for houses turned in to hotels) so we could hear the conversation of our neighbors, the flushing and the toilet and the shower! I would go back to that hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: SionRich
Reviews.Content: Lusia and the team at the Palm Gallery Hotel were a Godsend. Very Helpful and accommodating! The Hotel itself is very nice with great terrace and peaceful surrounds. The room was very nice, modern with a definite touch of class. The location is superb as it is close to many great attractions in Rome, though also in a safe quiet neighborhood. It is very Close to the NZ Embassy (Also Canadian and Australian) and this was perfect as i had to sort out some passport issues. All in All Lusia and her Handsome staff went beyond the call of duty to make the stay at The Palm Gallery a Blessing.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like your home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: carolann805
Reviews.Content: Staying at this lovely little hotel located in a charming neighborhood really made our trip to Rome memorable. It is near several bus stops that will take you anywhere you want to go in the city. We found that being located outside the city center was a great advantage. After a lovely breakfast on the outdoor patio we would take the bus, have a busy day in the city and return to the peace of the patio, have a drink and share experiences with fellow travelers and walk to a great neighborhood restaurant. I can't say enough about Louisa and Lorenzo and the staff and their personal helpful attention and wonderful hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: wballstadt
Reviews.Content: The Palm Gallery Hotel is located in a very nice part of Rome. The rooms with their high ceilings are spacious and tastefully furnished. It is relaxing to come back here and enjoy a drink on the front patio or garden after a busy day of sightseeing. The staff is friendly and very helpful. They are like family happy to chat with you about your day. Excellent restaurants nearby. Transit easily accessible. Staff will provide maps and directions to all the tourist sights. We still talk about the Palm Gallery and the staff. It made our trip to Rome FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could give it 6 Stars!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wand3r3r
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this website for the Palm Gallery Hotel have pretty much covered everything that needs to be said so I won't repeat all of the valid excellent comments. I choose to focus on the hotel services. Because we were at the end of a month-long journey thru Europe, we were tired and were late in making a reservation for our last stop before heading home. 2 days before arriving in Rome we sent an email to the hotel to inquire about reservations. Luisa responded immediately and said that she did not have 5 nights available, however she could put us up for 2 nights and could reserve a room at another hotel close by who happens to be a friend of hers. She would handle everything for us including a pick up at the train station, booking at the Palm Gallery and the other hotel, and transfer to the other hotel when we move. I have travelled extensively throughout the world and I have never, ever received such a comforting response. In most cases, we would have received a "Sorry, Not Available". However, Luisa made the effort to book us in her hotel AND take care of the rest of our stay. She even paid the the other hotel up front without having collected a penny from us. Daniel picked us up at the train station right on time and whisked us to the hotel with no problems. Luisa and her staff were so helpful in orienting us on public transport that by the 2nd day in Rome we could pretty much get to wherever we needed by using their maps and instructions. Our only regret is that we didn't reserve earlier because we were so sad to leave the Palm Gallery! The "other' hotel (the Villa Morgagni) turned out to be a very nice 4 star hotel which was even more convenient to public transport. Even though it was comparable it just didn't have the same "vibe" and welcome as the Palm Gallery Hotel. Our stay was too short but we would like to thank Luisa, Daniel, Vincenzo, and the rest of the staff for making it so enjoyable. Ron & Mari, San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Rome was made much nicer with the choice of the TA recommended Palm Gallery Hotel for 7 nights. For U.S travelers, the hotel is a cross between a hotel and a B&B. Very clean and well appointed rooms and baths, a very nice breakfast served at your leisure each morning (with egg dishes made to order) and a staff that is very accommodating. While we did not see a lot of Luisa (we were told she had illness in her family), Lorenzo, Tony, Daniel and Vincenzo provided all the friendly assistance we could want. The buses got us nicely to the center of the city each day and, as walkers, we wended our way home to Palm Gallery via a different route each day to really take in the flavor of the city. The staff recommended restaurants in the area and our favorites in order of our rating were: Osteriadell'Arco, Coure di Napoli, Pizzeria Pulcinella and Rist, I Butteri. Any stay in Rome would be greatly enhanced with the choice of Palm Gallery Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: MontgomerySussex
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on tripadviser, we had high expectations for this hotel. All our expectations were fulfilled. Do not be put off by the distance from the centre, the bus services were excellent, and the area the hotel is in gives a snapshot of life in Rome. Many thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skykate99
Reviews.Content: It is hard to add anything new to the reviews here, but hotel, and more importantly Luisa and her staff exceeded very high expectations we had. We booked 3 night but stayed for 5. We were met in the airport by Staphano (so much easier!) and welcomed with snacks and wine by Luisa as soon as we got to Palm Gallery. First time in Rome and we were provided by places to see, tips on where to buy tickets and such, restaurants to check out. We followed most of it and could not be happier. Our room was amazing- big, bright, comfortable. Breakfast is delicious and when we wanted. We used laundry service that was not expensive, professional and quick. Location is perfect for people who like to walk or public transportation available for those who don't. Took us about 45 min to walk everywhere and it was nice to be back to quiet street after busy day in Rome. As we were leaving, we were offered coffee and given water and snacks for our drive to Tuscany. We travel a lot and I have to say that Palm Gallery is my favorite place right now, by far the best customer service we ever encounter in the industry. What makes all the difference is that staff is not trained to help, they genuinely want to help. Luisa - thank you and your staff for making our stay such an amazing and memorable experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Saul7
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The place is very nice -- very comfortable rooms and great terrace -- and Luisa, the owner, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Highly professional but homely as well. The hotel is located in a very nice area of Rome. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “stop looking! You have found the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susuAccra
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a place to stay that is home away from home then this is for you..all the help and service you can possibly think of you will get from Palm Gallery hotel. Lusia made sure my baby had a special cot with all the fancy touches to make my baby feel comfortable.the staff are extreamly helpful, the coffee is amazing. close to everything,nice shops near by,resturants supermarket. i dont thik you will receive the hospitality from the big fancy hotels as you would from Palm Gallery Hotel. Lusia husband walked us to the bus stop and made sure we got our tickets and got on the bus, i dont think any hotel owner would do that. they have maps for bus stops or metro and maps for resturants nearby. very well organised. ill come here over and over again. Thank you Lusia and staff for making our stay a truly unquie one one more thing to mention that i dont think other hotels will do, Palm Gallery didnt have a room available for us the first night we came but Lusia arranged for a hotel near by (another good one), then came back the following day to pick us up and take us back to Palm Gallery hotel. You made my experience a truly good one. also rooms are extrealy clean, i mean very clean. Y

Reviews.Title: “GREAT stay!”
Reviews.Author: jean S
Reviews.Content: Loved it from the moment we arrived and had cool white wine and tapas on the deck! Luisa, Daniel and the staff are great! The rooms are tasteful and the service impeccible. Thank you, Luisa for initiating this wonderful way to relax while in Rome. Jean Silvernail

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: denzil J
Reviews.Content: The service at The Palm Gallery is amazing!! When we first arrived, we sat on the deck with complementary drinks while the staff checked us in and delivered our luggage into our rooms. Lusia, John-Carlo, Danielle and the other staff members felt like family; as they recommended places to see and eat, helped with flight complications and arranged for drivers. The rooms were beautiful; very clean and safe. We would highly recommend this hotel to everyone!!! Thanks Luisa and family

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tracy15
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent from Canada which recently stayed at the Palm Gallery hotel with a group of 11. This lovely small intimate hotel has and exceptional staff assisting with restaurant tour reservations and recommendations, the rooms are modern and comfortable, just a short bus or taxi just out of the hussle and bussle. WE really enjoyed sitting out on the deck having drinks at night and breakfast in the morning...it was so relaxing! I would highly recommend the Palm Gallery when visiting Rome! Thanks Luisa!! Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: edan
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at the Palm Gallery Hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly, especially Vincenzo who was very attentive. The owner, Luisa, suggested good restaurants in the area that offer very authentic Roman cuisine and are moderately priced. I thought the room was comfortable and very clean, the bathroom was also clean and modern, and the grounds are a definite plus. The breakfast is very good, the coffee excellent, and there is always some tea, fruits and little snacks during the day as well. Although the location didn't bother us too much, we even walked from the Pantheon to the hotel one night, walking during the day in the heat or taking the bus when it was crowded was a bit of a hassle. When in Rome the next time I might opt for a centrally located hotel that I could access more easily.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful and welcoming spot in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Diana N
Reviews.Content: Very attentive staff and comfortable accommodations a short bus ride from the frantic center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet in busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: KILester
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in the Palm Gallery as part of our Italian honeymoon in September 2011 after reading the other reviews on TA. We arrived in Rome on the train (Roma termini) and walked to the hotel - under 30mins with two suitcases isn't a problem in our book. All the staff were extremely welcoming, friendly and helpful (providing maps, places to eat and translating Italian emails from a bus company when my jacket went missing). The room and bathroom were to an excellent standard (my wife was very impressed with products in bathroom) and staff go to great efforts to create a warm ambience in the hotel. There is good choice for breakfast (staff will also offer to make omlettes etc) and you can either eat inside or out on the terrace. The hotel is undergoing some renovation work at the moment - new fitness room, new dining room but we didn't notice any undue noise and it didn't effect our stay. A great hotel and we would definately stay again! Kat & Ian Lester

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Atmosphere, and Location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravman
Reviews.Content: SERVICE: My fiancee and I got engaged at the beginning of our 2 week Euro Trip and our last stop was Palm Gallery in Roma. We were never treated as well (at 4-star Hilton's or boutiques) as we were at Palm Gallery. From the moment we arrived the staff made us feel comfortable and at home. We didn't report an issue with the TV channels, but it got fixed because the cleaning staff noticed it. We were served great snacks and breakfast. We got a real insiders guide to food/beverage in Roma and the staff reserved us a spot for a fantastic late-night dinner in a nearby park. ATMOSPHERE: If you want a "cookie-cutter" chain-hotel atmosphere, Palm Gallery is not that place. It is unique, stylish, and homey (not homely). The terrace is extremely relaxing before or after the inevitable long, hot walk in Rome. Our room was huge compared to what we've come to expect in Europe. The room had high ceilings, a nice cross breeze, and great natural lighting. The AC worked when needed and the amenities were also a nice touch (crisp dry towels, high-quality tolietries, etc.). LOCATION: We found the proximity to Termini train station to be perfect as a jump-off point for our touring. It is walkable (we did many times) but also has closer connections to the metro and city buses. We also walked back from the top of the Spanish Steps. It is not located in a busy neighborhood but we found everything we needed close by. We ate two great dinners at restaurants within 3-6 blocks (recommended by hotel staff). We also had access to grocery items when needed. I strongly recommend this place based on the above points. Regards, Travis

Reviews.Title: “Extended Visit in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Diarmaid H
Reviews.Content: This is truly a wonderful hotel - nothing could be too much trouble for Luisa and her excellent staff especially Daniel & Lorenzo. The hotel is situated in the Diplomatic Quarter of Rome and travel into the Centre is easy and cheap by tram or bus. The hotel will organise transport if you wish. There are numerous restaurants to suit all pockets nearby and the hotel provides detailed directions. When our stay was extended due to a strike in Italy Luisa was extremely helpful and supportive. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly atmosphere in a central location”
Reviews.Author: RuthundTobi C
Reviews.Content: Luisa and her staff welcomed us warmly and made our stay very special (visiting neighboring puppies and the ballet together!). The breakfast and snacks were extremely good, the house and garden itself were a wonderful retreat from the busy, highly fascinating and always exhausting Rome in summer. Don't miss this special place with a particularly friendly hostess on your next trip to Rome! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Accomodations and Welcoming Hosts”
Reviews.Author: catpat66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palm Gallery in August 2011 for four days. We found its location close enough to the main sites in Rome that taxi cabs were reasonable but far away enough from the tourist spots that meals were pleasant and affordable. We booked two rooms, one for my husband and I and one for our teenagers and both were very comfortable. Breakfasts were delicious and drinks on the patio under the large umbrellas were very relaxing. Luisa was most accomodating and all of the staff were very helpful. If we come back to Rome we will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectissimo- great for families!”
Reviews.Author: 960familyw
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel in a quiet, safe part of Rome, yet still close enough to get to the sights. There is a nice terrace and the rooms are spotless and stylish. The star of the show is Luisa who treats every guest as a special visitor. Our children, aged 12, 9 and 6 were made very welcome- and were specially introduced to the tortoises who roam the front garden. One evening we failed to find somewhere to eat and Luisa rustled up a light meal (there is no evening restaurant). She personally drove us to Rome Station to get an early morning train to Pompeii......Great lady, great hotel...you must visit

Reviews.Title: “Real Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Msolway
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed for 3 nights. The management at Pslm Gallery is caring and they went out of their way to help us in every possible way. They transported us from the airport in a comfortable Mercedes van, upgraded our rooms at no charge because they happened to be available; advised us on getting around Italy and walked us through purchasing train tickets online. They gave excellent recommendations for local non-tourist restaurants and were truly hospitable and welcomed our questions. Location is in not in center of town, which we liked because it was quiet. Rooms/Beds were comfortable, air conditioning & wifi worked great. breakfast was typical assortment of bread, pastries, cheese, yougurt, coffee. Just fine. Bottom line - a very cool place, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome stay”
Reviews.Author: Ptkemblatravellers
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palm Gallery and had a wonderful stay. The hotel has a distinctly middle eastern feel with it's quirky furnishings. The staff made us feel welcome and went out of their way to help. We had a problem with our hire car but Daniel led us to another rental return office and then drove us back to the hotel. Lorenzo and Vicenzo both booked museum entries for us at the hotel. It is a relaxing oasis after a hot days sight seeing. We thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rebeca2001
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Palm Gallery. Our room was beautiful, lots of light, nice bathroom and toiletries, and the bed was luxurious. It's located in a fairly affluent residential neighborhood of Rome where you will not run into many other tourists but that's not to say it's far from the sights of Rome. The bus got us into the historical center in 5-10 min and when we were feeling lazy a taxi ranged from 5-12 euros. The owner and the rest of the staff were friendly and super helpful. They have great restaurant recommendations for any budget. Our favorites were the neighborhood restaurants. Beware of Luisa's bus directions though, they're good for getting you into the general vicinity of where you want to go, but while they seem self-explanatory at the time once you're there you realize that the landmarks or street signs you're looking for to make a connection or turn are not quite as self evident! The best thing about the hotel was being able to get away from the frenetic pace of Rome after a long day of noise, crowds and walking. There was still a little noise late-night over the weekend but I can only imagine it would have been ten times worse in the center of Rome. We also used the hotel's airport shuttle service and it was well worth it! It saved us a huge hassle. I cant say enough about Louisa though, she was so warm and friendly, like your favorite aunt while also being unobtrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and well looked after”
Reviews.Author: Traveller4531
Reviews.Content: You can just relax and enjoy your holiday at the Palm Gallery. No rush to get up in the morning - whenever and your breakfast will be waiting. Sitting on the terrace eating breakfast was a relaxing experiences, one of the best times of the day (says someone who doesn't do breakfast!) The AC works great too, quietly in the background making sure you don't get too hot in the night. Beds comfy and room to spread out in. Lovely and clean. This is such a quiet area but so close everything you'll need - its just ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: torontolover_8
Reviews.Content: This is really a terrific place to stay. It's a bit "out of the action"- which for Rome, especially in the summer is a real plus. The rooms are lovely and the staff is incredibly helpful. They do everything possible to make the stay pleasent. Extra cappucino's in the morning to go with excellent brekafasts, good directuions and tips. One night they suggested a local restaurant t on a quiet square and we have a truly great meal.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic venue to fall in love with Rome”
Reviews.Author: SuziF_11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on their TripAdvisor reviews and I have to say if definitely lived up to its reputation. We stayed at the Palm Gallery for the second part of our honeymoon. The hotel is extremely elegant. The pictures on their website don't do justice to its look and feel. The owner Louisa has stamped her obvious style and world knowledge on this place, with artifcats from around the world, whilst maintaining a very chic style. The staff and Lousia and very helpful, providing copious maps and directions to all the attractions, sights and restaurants you will need. Don't be put off by the fact that the Palm Gallery isn't slap bang in the centre of Rome, we found transport to and from the hotel very easy and quick. It was also nice to be slightly out of the hussle and bustle of the city centre so at this location felt like we had a calmer experience. All in all, I highly recommend the Palm Gallery. If it were in the city centre we would have paid a lot more for what was a wonderful first time experience in Rome. My husband and I can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Small family owned great service”
Reviews.Author: OksanaAnel
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at Palm Gallery for couple of days in June. It is a small hotel located a bit far from the center (20-30 min bus ride to Colosseum). 10 min walk to bus station/20 min to the metro. Air conditioning, internet, TV were working - no problems. Towels were rough but I noticed it's just how it is everywhere in Italy. Service was great, great owner, attentive staff, clean rooms, nice patio. They are offering breakfast but if you are hungry during the day it is not a problem to ask for food and refreshments. Thy did have some construction going on but it didn't disturb us. Also one day we stayed in bed late and they were cleaning the rooms so it was loud. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: grantjenjen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go overseas once a year. we stayed at this lovely designed hotel and were so happy. we use the gym regulary and the enjoyed the service and the rooftop terrace. Thank you for an amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “A gem away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: asiangal
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased that we made the right choice to steer clear of the hotel options in town and spent 4 lovely nights in this perfect gem of a hotel. Everybody from Luisa the owner, Daniel the manager to the various helpers have been full of hospitality and warmth. The hotel is located in a quiet residential estate and was completely safe for us to walk back around mid night. The various dinner options recommended were within walking distance and provided a dining experience with the locals IE no tourist traps at horrendous prices. I stayed in 2 rooms, one a double and the other to accomodate a third travel companion. Both rooms were spotless and comfortable. Breakfast was something to look forward to, either in the cheery breakfast room or outdoors on the patio. The free wi-fi and free use of notebooks during our stay made getting in touch easy. We also chilled out at the patio in the evenings and got to chat with fellow guests. The distance to the sights is not something that cannot be overcome. There are buses to the key sites, and the nearest metro is about a 15 minute walk away. We also cabbed from the city at around ten euros. Overall, I would recommend this lovely hotel to any travelers who are looking at staying away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “lovely, relaxed hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jerseytraveler00
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Palm Gallery. The rooms were spacious and immaculately kept -even the bathrooms were up-to-date. We loved the front porch, covered with large umbrellas to keep us shaded and cool, while we ate breakfast or had snacks and drinks before dinner. The staff went above-and -beyond to help us with phone call reservations and transportation issues. My only negative comment is the location of this hotel - it really isn't "walking distance" to any place we wanted to go. So we relied on the bus system which was sometimes hot and crowded and often intricate in navigating. We also used the taxis which were not familiar with the street Palm Gallery was located on - and they were pricey as well. I recommend that future guests take advantage of Luisa's airport and/or railway pick-up and drop-off service. It was very convenient for us especially since we also had our luggage to deal with. Palm Gallery is a very friendly, service-oriented hotel with a wonderful owner and staff. Stay there - just be prepared to travel like the locals!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel off the beaten path in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TX_traveler26
Reviews.Content: The Palm Gallery hotel is truly one-of-a-kind. From our first steps on the property, we felt like we were staying at the home of a friend. Luisa, the owner, is the perfect hostess who greeted us with a bottle of Prosecco and snacks which we enjoyed on the lovely front balcony. We quickly became acquainted with the hotel cats, especially Romeo. We spent some time every morning and evening on the balcony, enjoying the beautiful gardens and peacefulness of the neighborhood. Luisa went out of her way to make our stay fabulous even having drinks with us late one evening to celebrate my husband's birthday. The accomodations are lovely. Our room was very comfortable and quite large even though we had three people staying in it. With the maps provided by Luisa it was no problem to take the bus all over Rome. Be sure, though, to either utilize Luisa's car service from the train station or the bus as we were price-gauged by a taxi driver. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at the Palm Gallery and will look forward to returning again!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely villa. Friendly staff. Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: jjmb
Reviews.Content: The title just about sums it up. This is not your run of the mill hotel. Great decor, spacious rooms and great staff. We were welcomed by Daniel, who kept a parking spot saved for us and then welcomed us with a lovely bottle of wine. The hotel has a quiet garden perfect for relaxing after a busy day exploring. It's a bit of a distance from some major tourist areas but definitely worth it. We look forward to staying here again on our next trip to bella Roma.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in Rome - lovely place made by the Owners!”
Reviews.Author: CharlieandGus
Reviews.Content: We spent our final night at this hotel in Rome. While it was a little bit of a journey out of the city of Rome, it's very well connected and its great to get away from the hustle and bustle! We were made to feel very welcome and special, and we knew it would be a relaxing stay from the start. The rooms are very comfortable and it feels a lot like being in a luxe B&B rather than an impersonal hotel. I highly reccommend this place. We used the hotel's bus service to get a transfer to the airport which was great and very stress free!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, I have no idea why people love this place so much.”
Reviews.Author: sedillo
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing here, I admit that. They helped us do "Rome in a day", which is all we had, and gave us 1-day unlimited ride (4 euro) metro passes, which everyone visiting Rome should get. You have to leave your room key in the lobby, which I hate to do. It did not seem to be closely monitored. The hotel is in the middle of a residential area and is not close to the subway at all. Take the bus or use the hotel's transportation. The hotel was very expensive for its location, along with the transportation it offered. It took us hours to get to the hotel from the Fiumicino airport and luckily two Roman gentlemen GPS'd it for us on their smartphones. Otherwise, we would have never found it. This was the most frustrated I had been on our 6-country trip, and I even had multiple directions. Here's a tip: Stay at the Hilton Rome Fiumicino Airport hotel that offers a free shuttle into Rome (which will save you 30 euros per person round trip, and a whole lot of time on public transportation). Also, this hotel was more expensive than the Hilton Rome Airport when we stayed at it. I was so frustrated about its location, that it overshadowed the service.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: midnightmid
Reviews.Content: For the discerning traveller... A very special little hotel just outside the city centre in a lovely residential area, which is safe and quiet. We stayed four nights and loved every minute. Luisa and her staff are like a family, and treat guests like family too. We were a party of five, two mums and three grown-up daughters. Our rooms were beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean, and very quiet. The hotel is a lovely old building with a big shady terrace. Just the place for a drink after a hard day's sightseeing. Luisa provides maps and advice for almost everything - trips to the Vatican/Colosseum/shopping. She can give you bus tickets too, and we were walked to the bus stop on day one, to ensure we got the right bus. Useful tip: eat locally, not in the city centre. We used Luisa's map for local restaurants, all of which are about five minutes walk from the hotel. We found ourselves in properly Italian restaurants, eating the most exquisite food. Not pricey either. Other useful tip: we wished we'd the Palm Gallery airport pick up... we got horribly ripped off by the taxi drivers at the Termini Station. Rome is full on in July, so this hotel was the perfect sanctuary at the end of a hot, busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round”
Reviews.Author: womantravelling
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. All the staff, especially its owner Louisa, are fantastic. Best hotel service in Europe in my travels in 15 years. Due to our late booking (i.e. our fault, not their's) we stayed in three rooms - all were fantastic. Gardens and flowers were gorgeous, rooms clean and lovely. Breakfast and drinks all fab. Have already made plans to go back with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Special Gem, perfect for family in balmy Roma summer”
Reviews.Author: ParisAtlas
Reviews.Content: A lovely spot for a few summer days in Roma with two children. Escape the noise and bustle & enjoy the unique hospitality - Luisa, Stefano, Vincenzo & the whole staff. It is an elegant building in a nice tranquil area, close enough to everything but so nice to enjoy a little quiet and relaxation as well. The room was excellent: elegant and spacious with two windows, air and nice bathroom. Breakfast in the morning in the garden area, and we had pizza outside in the garden at night with a great local beer. Enjoy the lovely breakfast outside beneath the large sun umbrellas. Two good internet access points to have connectivity on any floor. A small room filled with magazines, and comfortable inside easting area and television. They make you feel comfortable, at home, and the kids enjoyed it. I feel lucky to have found this spot and will enjoy returning.

Reviews.Title: “home sweet home-Oh Yah!”
Reviews.Author: positanocs
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel and all that work there. I would love to revisit Rome just so that I could stay here again. All of my trip stories to family and friends have included stories about my time at the Palm Gallery. The rooms were very tidy and very comfortable. The patio was relaxing with drinks, food and lots of conversation with other guests and staff. Lorenzo went out of his way to research Maria Montesssori for me when I asked about the location of the first Montessori school. He went above and beyond. He also makes a great cocktail!

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto”
Reviews.Author: LindaBrittB
Reviews.Content: In June, I took a trip to Rome with my 3 best friends. We saw numerous attractions (the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Pantheon, Sistine Chapel, Trevi Fountain, etc.), but when asked about my trip, the one thing that I cannot stop talking about is the Palm Gallery Hotel. From start to finish, this place does it right. When I wrote to Luisa, the hotel's owner, back in December to inquire about rates and availability, she sent me not only a description of each room option, but also a synopsis of the hotel's neighbourhood, options for pick up at either the airport or train station, and a link to a website showing bus routes to points of interest. The fabulous service continued throughout our stay. Luisa has put together a great staff in Daniel, Lorenzo, Vincenzo, Farukh and others. They are all friendly, personable and outgoing, and honestly, cannot do enough for you. These guys really go over and above in terms of service, hunting down English-language newspapers for guests, making restaurant recommendations, playing host, bartender, concierge and chauffeur all in one. They make staying here really feel like home. The rooms at the Palm Gallery are lovely too. Very clean, nicely appointed and with very comfortable beds (which for Europe, can be a stretch). I loved the hotel's location; residential but well within striking distance of all major attractions either on foot (Borghese Gallery), by bus (Pantheon, Vatican) or metro (Colosseum is only 4 stops away). Do yourselves a favour and stay at this hotel. After a long, hot day of sightseeing, you will love relaxing on the front deck with a beer or a glass of Friuli, a bowl full of olives and caper berries and great conversation and laughs with the staff and fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “They spoiled us for all the other hotels we went to after them.”
Reviews.Author: susankhunter
Reviews.Content: it was our first trip to Italy and we were concerned about finding our way around Rome. We arrived by rail and were greeted at coach side by Daniel, Palm Gallery right hand man, who quickly took us to his waiting vehicle and took us to the hotel. The hotel was located in a beautiful,quiet neighborhood with embacies just down the street and two large, lovely parks nearby. The location was perfect as it was close to everything, but just far enough away to be relaxing and peaceful. We were greeted at the hotel by Louisa, who was amazing, helpful, and charming. Our luggage was carried to our rooms while we were treated to wine and appetizers. I asked for iced tea and they didn't have any so they quickly brewed some for me and made sure I had a fresh pitcher each morning in the frig. Each day Daniel delivered us to our tour locations, made sure we found our tour leader, and showed us how to go to another spot by taxi, bus, or metro reminding us that he would be happy to help us leaving a card with each of us. The breakfast on the terrace were wonderful, highlighted by fresh fruit, warm crescent rolls, great coffee choices and many other entrees. Rome was hot and harried and we loved it, but we relished going back to The Palm Galley to freshen up and have a quiet drink on the terrace to cool down before embarking on another adventure. Louisa, Daniel, and the staff were informative, helpful and utterly charming. We could not have asked for more. The room was spacious and spotless and the neighborhood offered so many opportunities for dining. We were able to see Italians with their families away from the tourist crowds. The title says Hotel, but it is much more like a bed and breakfast. I travel a lot and I have never been so impressed and pleased with my accommodations. We felt like family. They truly spoiled us for the rest of our hotels on the trip. I highly recommend Palm Gallery if you are traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away from Home...”
Reviews.Author: MargaretWB
Reviews.Content: My three best friends and I celebrated a milestone birthday by traveling to Rome this summer and the Palm Gallery Hotel was by far one of the best elements of the trip thanks to the owner Luisa and her wonderful staff including Daniel, Lorenzo, Feruq (sorry if I misspelt the name!) and Vinceso! It was a second home for us and the hotel was beautifully situated so that we were close to all ammenities so everything was extremely easy to get to for sight seeing, adventuring, etc. The rooms were lovely and very comfy! I truly loved everything about this hotel and its people and highly recommend this as the best hotel in Rome. Luisa and her staff treated us as old friends and were truly wonderful and very accomodating. I can't wait to go back and stay there and visit with my new friends! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: JT_Auckland
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel. We used their shuttle pick up service from the airport which was well worth it and excellent. The hotel is a small boutique hotel in a very quiet location off the beaten track. But only 10-15 minutes walk from the Metro so very easy to get anywhere we wanted in Rome. Surrounded by excellent restaurants we had no problem finding good food to eat. The room we had was spacious and very comfortable and quiet, immaculately clean. The outside deck was the perfect retreat after a hard day's sightseeing and bar facilities available. We ate breakfast out on the deck each morning, a good selection of food. Staff were excellent and extremely helpful. The owner Luisa was particularly helpful - even to the extent of driving us to the train station when no taxis were available at short notice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: McLeaps
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Palm Gallery at the end of June. What a great lodging experience. Rome is beautiful and magical but at times hectic and exhausting. The Palm Gallery was a welcomed oasis away from, yet easily accessed, central city. We were met on arrival by owner Louisa who warmly welcomed us and suggested we rest awhile on the very relaxing hotel porch. This was a place we used for breakfast and for late afternoon and nighttime drinks and conversation with other guests. Our triple room was beautifully designed, spacious, clean and very comfortable. Louisa has thoughtfully designed every element in the hotel. The entire Palm Gallery staff is friendly and efficient. Would definitely recommend staying here when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Another glowing review - as wonderful hospitiality”
Reviews.Author: 3tothebeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two wonderful nights in the largest "panaromic" room at the Palm Gallery. The room was very spacious - no view - can hear laughing children in the day (school) What makes this place outstanding is the owners (Donna) and folks who work here! They literally will NOT Say NO~ what I mean - help to book the vacatican on line - why of course - borrow their guide book; where to go out drink; book a dinner for eight - NO problem. I loved them all = The breakfast is OK - the people and even the other guest in this small intimiate hotel make this so special. This was the first stop as we got on a cruise in Rome and it was my favorite~

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time there”
Reviews.Author: Nese_11
Reviews.Content: Peaceful, silent and homely. Great terrace and garden. One feels taken care of. Very comfortable and elegant rooms are very neatly designed and equipped. Easy to access the center Rome, but this area is also something to see with nice houses, parks, and restaurants. Luisa, the owner is a very caring person and the hotel reflects her attitude. The staff, each of them are great. I would certainly recommend..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxing way to end our tour of Italy”
Reviews.Author: Travelingfoolish
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful experience from start to finish. We stayed here for the last few days of a wonderful, exhausting tour of Italy. Luisa met us at the door with tea and refreshments. she took care of us like family throughout our stay. The room was beautiful, quiet and for the first time on our trip- the bathroom and shower were spacious and comfortable! Great neighborhood with easy walking to bus stops giving quick access to the city sights. The decor in the room was great, with fresh flowers and not one detail overlooked. We were not disappointed with this lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Family Villa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franklinkitt
Reviews.Content: A very pleasent family villa hotel well situated within a short bus ride to all the tourist areas of Rome. The hotel owner and her staff were most efficient and professional at all times. Our "on suite" ground floor room was very comfortable and airey with a garden view and acess to a pleasent terrace deck. The hotel has it´s own airport van service for clients arriving and departing Rome, which we found very convienient. We would certainly choose to stay at the Palm Gallery Hotel when next visiting Rome. Esther and Franklin

Reviews.Title: “Wonferful Hotel, Great Hospitality and Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelphilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent out 15th anniversary in Europe and had the pleasure of spending two nights in this wonderful hotel (May 22 & 23). We travel alot as I am also a travel agent and we could not have been happier with this hotel. From the time we arrived, we were offered breakfast/coffee/tea and immediately taken to our room. We were on the 3rd level in a bright and airy corner room. The bed was heavenly and the shower was an awesome jaccuzi shower! Lucinda & Daniel were awesome. They also recommended awesome resturants all within walking distance. There were tour books available as well as maps of how to get to many tourist destinations. I will be recommending this hotel to anyone who needs to stay in Rome and is looking for the type of customer service and hospitality that only a boutique hotel can offer. My husband and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Why this small boutique hotel is simply the best stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: QuickWorld
Reviews.Content: The good experience starts from the day you book your room. I spoke to the staff manager Daniel. He was very polite & when I finalized my booking I received the confirmation in an hour. The day we landed we were received at the Airport by a smart warm Italian gentleman named Stefano. The ride to hotel was nice in a spacious van. On arriving at the hotel we were warmly welcomed by Luisa the owner. She offered us the red Orange juice & some snacks. We spent some good time at the porch + terrace they have. The hotel is spotlessly clean & fresh with flowers in the gardens. The neighborhood is calm quite worth every penny to get some peace after a hectic day in Rome. The rooms are big for European Standards & the ceiling is oh so high 3 Metres. The Cozy Room is best for couples with limited baggage & usually we travel light. The breakfast is good & dont miss the Orange juice which is red in color. There are fruits available & if you have any special needs just ask Luisa. The hotel staff is so polite & humble you would think you have never left home. Lorenzo, Daniel , Luisa & the staff make sure you have everything you need & more. You can disturb them anytime & they will always have a smile on their face & tend to you with warmth. They will bid you Ciao when you leave for the day & then arrive back again. The square near the hotel Piazza Caprera has a nice fountain where you can stroll at night for a walk before you hit the sack. It has nice eating options , the one in Villa Torlonia has a pizza & Tiramisu best ones we ever had. There also a Thai restaurant nearby which is also pretty nice. The Restaurant Villa Paganini is a little extravagant & not for vegetarians(we wrongly chose to eat there but it seems to be a fish eaters paradise). MY BIGGEST TIP IS BUY A ROMA PASS. (Recmnd by Trip Advisor Also) Its worth 25 Euros as you can get to Colosseum & Forums & Galleria Borghese for free. 12 Euro for Colosseum & Forums + 8.5 EUR for Galleria Borghese and you can travel for 3 days until midnight of the third. ( you will need to reserve the entrance in advance by calling but just show the Roma Pass at entrance) . Use the Roma Pass for two sites which are paid & you want to visit. Your best bet towards town is bus 62 from Via Nomentana , 88 & 80. These are very near the hotel & 62 is spot on for Piazza Venezia , you can walk to Colosseum. It also travels on Via Del Plebiscito which your best bet back too & also for Pantheon , Trevi Fountain. Just visit www.atac.roma.it and use it in English with proper dates & time. It will give you routes for all the busses. Use Via Nomentana 2nd Stop for the hotel. Always keep two maps at hand in case you need it. Ask Luisa for 2 of the maps she always has , a map of nearby hotels & a map of nearby bus stops. Also visit goitaly.about.com wikitravel & frommers rome in a day , 2 days If you are not in a hurry you can always walk to all the sites. All in all I will return to this hotel every time I visit Rome. If you want a clean calm end at the day & not the hustle bustle of the city , if you want to be taken care of & not just be some customers & if you want to meet really good people when you discover the Eternal City ... this is the hotel to be. You would find it amazing that how can a small boutique hotel achieve all this , it is in the warmth with which they attend to you that makes it special & gets it the rave reviews it truly deserves.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service. Location is not in center but metro and bus station are really close. Great restaurants and near. Service excee”
Reviews.Author: marcetarcur
Reviews.Content: We went with my sisters. And everythin smells delicios the enviroment is relax and the location is not near from the center but is not a problem because you can move easyly in bus. Service is amazing. They give you specified maps and advice to move and do around rome. Free capuchinos. You feel like home. Nice details like candy, fresh fruit and flowers. Variety of pastry. Luisa the owner and the hole crew are awesome!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect experience.”
Reviews.Author: shscw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel for six nights. Luisa seamlessly navigated our family through room changes that we had requested and each room was immaculately clean, elegantly furnished, with great light and ventilation. The staff was friendly and efficient. This hotel is awesome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Allison040
Reviews.Content: The staff and the hospitatlity was second to none! We were so happy with the warm reception we received from the Manager. Very accommodating. And, the place is intimate, clean and wonderful. We highly recommend this lovely little boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonLucyLu
Reviews.Content: We found this fab hotel through Trip Advisor and once again TA helped us have a great trip! This hotel is based just outside the city center and in a really nice neighborhood. Do not be put off that it is just outside the middle of Rome, for us this was a true bonus.... you actually want to escape the noise and buzz of the city. It is so easy to get back in, the number 80 bus stop is a 4 min walk away and that bus comes every 3 mins and in 5 mins you are there in the middle - it was so easy. (nb there are many other buses to also chose from and the metro - no more than 5 -10 mins walk away) On our first day we actually walked from the hotel all the way to the Spanish Steps through Park Borgase - again no major effort and shows how well placed the hotel is. The hotel itself is simple but classy. The room was lovely with a great shower. The only disappointment was that the double bed was in fact two single beds pushed together, not sure if this is the normal in Italy - but might be worth checking when you book. There is a lovely sunny terrace where you can have your coffee outside. The breakfast was nice - very simple - but more than adequate for such a hotel, you will not be disappointed. So our tips to a trip to Rome : 1. Stay in this hotel - it really is great value and far better than staying in the middle of Rome 2. Ask the wonderful Luisa for her maps. She really does have a map for every adventure and she is really very helpful 3. Get a good map of Rome before you start. We made the mistake of not doing this and got confused and lost - then we got one ! 4. Do not buy drinks in the center of town. We walked just a little towards our hotel and instead of 9 euros for a small peroni, we paid 3 euros for a large peroni. The difference in price was shocking, don't fall into the tourist trap - always check the menu before you sit. 5. We bought bread, salami and cheese from supermarket and had picnic for lunch each day - SO much cheaper and just as nice 6. Don't buy anything from the kiosks outside the main tourist attractions - they are ridiculously over priced 7. When you go to Collesum , buy your ticket from the entrance to the Forum (just 200 meters down the road). There was a 45min queue to buy ticket at the Col and we had got this tip from Trip Advisor - there was zero queue at the Forum. The same ticket lets you into both sites. Once you have your ticket, you walk straight into the Col. This was the TOP TIP ! 8. The Vatican Museums was great - but we only spent an hour or so there. Still don't miss it for the Sistine Chapel. 9. On the Saturday we went for a day trip to Pompei. Totally doable and so worth it. We left on the 8.27 train (went on the cheap one which was 10.50 euro and 3 hours, but it was fine (we read a book!) then at Naples, look for the Circumstavia signs for the local train - you can get the ticket for that train there - and 30 mins and you at Pompei.
