The train drops you to the front door. 3 hours at Pompei was more than enough and we were back in Rome by 7pm. (once again we were organised and took a picnic) 10. Get the 116 Bus to Travestre. It is a great way to see the back streets of Rome !! 11. Do not spend any time at all near Termni train station. it is a simply horrible place full of tramps and dodgy people. So relieved that we didn't stay in that area. Overall we had a great trip and staying in the Palm Gallery Hotel certainly made it relaxing and comfortable. Hope this review is helpful to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: mattie12903
Reviews.Content: I have to say this B&B was a great find. This was our first trip to Italy, and everyone at the hotel was very helpful. The room was cleaned daily and was perfect size. They had maps to all the sites and told you which buses to take to get to each. They sold bus passes at the hotel, which was also helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - like home but better!”
Reviews.Author: alden110
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure to stay at Palm Gallery for 3 nights during a recent trip to Italy. The hotel was easily a highlight of our trip. The host and staff are incredibly welcoming and helpful. The hotel itself is clean, spacious and beautiful. There is a lovely garden in front where we enjoyed breakfast (which is phenomenal, great variety of high quality italian breakfast treats - better than the spreads we got in higher-end hotels!). The rooms are spacious and very clean and comfortable - again, look like those in a much more expensive hotel. The neighborhood is peaceful, safe and quiet - we left our windows open at night to the sounds of birds and bugs, which was lovely. That being said, there is a drawback to the peaceful location - it's a bit of a walk from the main sights. We took the metro, which is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Not bad at all, and an easy trade for everything else great. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat and would recommend to anyone visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing small hotel in the midst Rome with beautiful rooms and garden”
Reviews.Author: nelsonandbronte
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an inspiration. We were greeted by the owner Louisa when we arrived late at night With a warm welcome. The hotel itself is a gem with beautiful furniture made by Louisa and her friends. When I displayed an interest in the technical details they were kind enough to explain them in some depth. it is very well placed — very close to the beautiful villa Borghese Gardens. The rooms, breakfast, serviced, and so on and so forth were without exception very good. The gardens are nice to sit in though small. Breezer was also very helpful with guidance about what to see in Rome and restaurants to go to — not only with advice about ancient and Renaissance Rome but also with advice about current artistic and architectural places to see such as the Maxxi Museum of the 21st century. It was left to our last day to see it and turned out to be very interesting indeed about contemporary architecture and art. - And she generously explained the technical details to us in some depth

Reviews.Title: “The perfect boutique hotel in all respects - amenities, location, and service all excellent.”
Reviews.Author: BBoomer53
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my husband on a 60th birthday trip, our experience at the Palm Gallery Hotel was first to last everything we had hoped for, and often exceeded our expectations. The room was airy and light, well decorated and furnished. The bathroom was well-designed and roomy, not something one often finds. Everything worked. The location in a green and quiet residential area, yet well serviced by both bus and metro to the center of Rome, was perfect for sightseeing without getting mired in the noise and clamor of the center at night. The area of the hotel remained peaceful all day. The staff went above and beyond as a matter of routine. Personally I loved the garden, and the sun deck at the front, surrounded by greenery and the perfect place for a glass of wine to unwind. Louisa, the owner, is a fascinating and caring host, and Daniel and the other young men were always attentive and helpful. The one aspect that is currently being rectified is the relatively cramped guest lounge/breakfast room - the renovations of the new area downstairs were held up due to requirements to prove they hadn't hit ruins when they discovered an old cellar - but the new area, much larger lounge and a cafe/breakfast room, should be finished by mid-June. Yet even with the smaller area, I wouldn't have stayed anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Calm environment with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rolinski
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Palm Gallery Hotel in Rome. The hotel is situated in a very calm and green area of Rome that helps to unwind after whole-day sightseeing in busy city areas filled with tourists. Also, the place is famous among Romans for a very high quality dining. The hotel can arrange smooth pick up service both from Fiumicino airport and from Termini station where Leonardo Express train arrives from the airport. A kind and handsome young man, Daniel was waiting for us with a name board. He carried our suitcase to the car and our room. Rooms of the hotel are new, clean and importantly contain beautifully arranged paintings and artifacts from various trips of Luisa, hotel`s owner, to African countries. Our bathroom had also hand-carved ceramic plates with black stones. There is also a study room in hotel and large terrace where I enjoyed reading book and another guest was tasting a glass of red wine. Coffee and tea can be served all the time and also there is access to fresh fruits, yogurt, and small Italian cakes. Breakfast is very rich and diverse. It contains Italian "spremuta di arancia" - freshly squeezed juice with fruit-flesh from red oranges from Sicily. Luisa approached us in a very polite, direct and informal way that can built trust. Her email replies with inquires abut hotel were also timely. The closest Metro station is Policlinico. The closest tramp/bus station is Piazza Dalmazzia. From there, it is only 5 minutes on to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best trip ever just got better with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gullo1978
Reviews.Content: This was me and my wife's first time visiting Rome for pleasure and it could not have been more pleasant (reference we are in our low 30s) . The sites, sounds, food, and people make this City one of a kind. Me and my wife stayed at the Palm Gallery and I have to say truly made the trip better. Luisa was the hotel's owner and she made us feel right at home with everything from maps, delicious treats in the morning, best places to eat, and how to navigate the public transportation. She will bend over backwards to make you feel like a king and queen. I felt like she was my Mother away from home. You can't stop there, Daniel the manager at the Palm, is the nicest and most hospitable person you will have ever met. We stayed up to the weee hours of the night talking and exchanging stories from each others home countries while me and my wife sat on the beautiful front terrace sipping wine from the hotel's own wine cellar. It really couldn't get much better! The atmosphere at the hotel is surrounded by lush vegetation and magnificent single family roman homes that take your breath away every time you look out the window or stroll down the street to the nearby restaurant. The rooms were always clean and tidy and they supply you with the bests bathing products. The location is not down in the center city so one does have to take a taxi or a quick bus ride to the sites, but trust me you will like it more that way! I was wary at first, but now I wouldn't have any other way. I just can't wait to get back to this hotel and the friends that me and my wife made there, they are truly special.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly, modern Italian boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: FiMcB
Reviews.Content: Well I really don't know where to start.. If you are reading this review and you are researching places to stay in Rome then you MUST stay here.  If you want friendly, relaxed, helpful, kind hotel owners then this is the place. If you want yummy Italian breakfast and coffee always served with a smile, the this is the place! (One day during our stay, my boyfriend and I slept  through our alarm and woke up at 1 o'clock in the afternoon!! And there was STILL someone to offer us coffee and a light breakfast!). My boyfriend and I made use of the airport transfer service offered by the hotel, adds slightly to the overall cost however ensures relaxed arrival and departure.  We stayed over New Year and Luisa provided us with a beautiful little hamper as we were leaving to head out to Rome to join in the New Years Eve celebrations! It included a bottle of champagne, bread, sweets and fruit - so kind and very yummy!  In the immediate hotel area are a number of fabulous restaurants and shops. Delightful restaurants including a divine steakhouse and a stunning pizzeria which was a real find! Both of these restaurants were included in the information sheets made available to us whilst we were staying there. Really helpful little maps and restaurant information were happily provided by Luisa and her team whilst we were there.  One evening after having had a day of full on sightseeing we decided to stay in for the evening. Luisa promptly set about settling us into a lovely little seating area, brought us little plates of meat, nuts and olives. We were able to choose from an interesting array of wines and the one we 'finally' chose was delicious!  Our room was great! Great big windows, spacious, light and airy. En-suite shower and WC. Every day the room was tidied and straighten! Fresh flowers and sweets every day. Towels were changed regularly and gorgeous shower gel provided.  We really enjoyed the fact we were situated slightly outside of the centre. The Metro was easy to navigate  and a short walk to it from the hotel. Oh and the buses are easy to use too!   We will DEFINITELY return to the Palm Hotel in the future. We have recommended Luisa's lovely hotel to friends and family and said that it is definitely the place to stay in Rome.  On our last morning we walked round the local area and ended up buying some fresh pasta to take home. We told Luisa who promised to email through a pasta sauce receipe to go with our pasta.. And she did too!  Many thanks go to Luisa, Daniel and the rest of the team at the Palm Hotel for an unforgettable stay!  Many thanks Fiona and Mark x

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel. Will definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: ellie999
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely wonderful. The room and the bathroom were large and the bed very comfortable. Luisa, the owner, is always ready to help with any questions or concerns and recommended several absolutely terrific restaurants. Hotel is a bit on the outside of the touristy city center, but there are may buses that will take you anywhere you need to go. The attention to detail of the hotel staff was fantastic. We will definitely be coming back the next time we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Piggywig65
Reviews.Content: The Palm Gallery Hotel is a haven away from the hustle and bustle of central Rome. Luisa is a lovely host as is Daniel her Manager, the rest of the staff being very polite and helpful, nothing seems too much trouble. The bedroom we had was very clean and modern with a most comfortable bed, lovely crisp white sheets and excellent pillows. with a clean and bright bathroom. Always enjoyed the breakfast, especially the freshly squeezed orange juice. Whenever we returned from sightseeing we were always offered tea or coffee, a nice touch. Fresh flowers were in all the rooms which gave the hotel a homely touch. All in all one of the best hotels we have stayed in. There are plenty of restaurants in the area and Luisa or Daniel will advise and give directions. Don't be put off by the distance to the sights as public transport is good, once you get your bearings!

Reviews.Title: “A friends recommendation - and it was everything he said it was”
Reviews.Author: david_mccomb
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long weekend at the Palm Gallery with my wife and found it superb....Luisa,Daniel and the team at the hotel could not do enough by way of service.....quality of rooms,food,drink were excellent. The garden and pation were a great place to relax in the evening after a day strolling in Rome. The location is near enough ....but far enough away for a peaceful night. The Palm gallery was suggested by a friend who had stayed there late last year....I am grateful for the recommendation. David McComb

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: laenie
Reviews.Content: Everything positive you read about this hotel is correct! Everyone we encountered at this hotel was so helpful and giving, even before our arrival I had emailed back and forth and Luisa and her crew were so helpful and gave good information. My friend and I stayed here on our return from a cruise and we were so tempted to change our flights and stay longer. From the moment we were picked up at the pier to the last goodbye at the airport, we felt pampered and like family! I told my husband we are definitely going back and would recommend this hotel to everyone! Every area was spotless, beds were comfy, bathrooms were well appointed, snacks and drinks were always available and Luisa even got up extra early to insure we had a tasty breakfast before leaving for the airport! We felt like we were family and miss them already!

Reviews.Title: “A home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Tibajo
Reviews.Content: Welcoming, hospitable, friendly, relaxing, beautiful, great area, helpful, caring, and a place to totally feel at home in one of my favorite cities in the word; Rome! I am looking forward to return, next time with a friend or my kids, possibly my whole family:-) The owner Luisa is a very friendly, relaxing person, you can ask her any questions and she has great ideas (shops and great terraces too!!) and tips of what to do or what to visit and Daniel and the other people working in the hotel are so friendly and very helpful, feels for sure like a holiday! Being picked up at the airport is also a good thing to do, Daniel drives safe :-) The hotel is very beautiful, with a terrace in the sun...the area is quiet and pretty (amazing family houses, and the birds and the flowers!) surrounded by parks and nice restaurants, a safe area to walk around in (also for a woman alone), and it is very close to the city center. O and the rooms? great! tastefully decorated and clean, and you also have WIFI for free. Go and experience it yourself:-D

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SiljeO
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five days in the beginning of March, and we had a great time! Luisa, Daniel and the others are extremely service minded and made our stay delightful. Bringing our 1 year old boy was no problem at all, and they had nearly everything that we needed for him, including a brand new stroller! Breakfast was delicious, the room was spacious, the bathroom was beautiful and the surrounding area was quiet and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, small, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPriceEssexUK
Reviews.Content: I would endorse all the positive comments already submitted about Palm Gallery. We were extremely well looked after from the moment we were met at the airport until we were dropped back there at the end of our trip. The beds were firm but comfortable with lovely linen. The bathrooms were excellent, clean, with good hot showers and luxury toiletries. We had one large double room and one twin room which was small but adequate for our teenage daughters' needs. Breakfast was good, fresh bread, pastries, cheese, ham, fresh fruit juice, and fresh apples, oranges, bananas, and kiwi, excellent coffee. There is still work being undertaken on the hotel but we were not disturbed by it. The hotel is a little way out of the centre, about 20 minutes walk to the bus terminal, but the neighbourhood is friendly and quiet with plenty of good restuarants and bars. The cafe and roof top terrace are not yet open and the hotel is small but if you like to stay somewhere owned and staffed by people who really care about their guests then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our most enjoyable hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Padraicd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Palm Gallery in September 2010 for 3 nights. The Hotel is a bit away from the main attractions but the area aound the hotel is really quiet with lots of tree lined streets and some really nice restaurants closeby and its only a short walk from the bus stop which takes you to the main termini. This is not your typical 3 star hotel, its more like a B+B, all the rooms are unique and tastefully decorated with lots of nice design touches, the beds are comfy, flat screen tv, internet and the bathrooms are large with good showers and toiletries. We were very lucky with the weather and enjoyed the really nice breakfast on the front terrace every morning and we ended our day sitting on the terrace with a bottle of wine talking to Giancarlo or whatever guests,dogs,cats were still up. If you enjoy the familiarty of chain hotels don't stay here because you will find faults but if you want to enjoy real hospitality then this is the place to stay. The staff and the owner Giancarlo couldn't have been more helpful or welcoming, they really put effort into making sure that you enjoy your stay in the hotel and have great advice on enjoying your stay in Rome. We can't wait for an excuse to go back

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Luisa!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Filippo_SB
Reviews.Content: The hotel made my brief Rome stay incredibly comfortable and made me really feel at home. It has none of the impersonal stereotypes of other hotels, it's cozy, in great condition (opened only in 2010), furnished with great taste, very bright, extremely comfortbale beds, and of course the most friendly staff. When I arrived Daniel greeted me with a great smile and took care of my check-in whilst I was invited to have a beer with Luisa, the owner and manager of the hotel. What a great introduction! Anything my friends and I needed it was not a problem, we had internet, there was a designated smoking room (in the summer they open the beautiful balcony perfect for sunny relaxion), they did my laundry, and they opened the door at any time of the night, couldn't have been more flexible. All in all a value/price package that is difficult to find elsewhere in Rome (and I know because I'm Italian). Next time I'm in Rome I know where I'll be going...

Reviews.Title: “A really friendly and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublin1981075
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really lovely. The staff were very welcoming and extremely helpful. The rooms were decorated beautifully and were spotlessly clean. It was located about a 30 minute walk from the Trevi fountain but there is a regular bus route nearby. This really is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in - I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a part of the family.”
Reviews.Author: Hankuroo
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped off of the plane and was greeted by Daniel from the Palm Gallery Hotel, we were treated with such grace and respect and we were pleasantly surprised with his command of the English language. Then we were personally welcomed at the hotel by owner Luisa, who graciously gave us food and beverages after our long journey from the States. She advised us on sight seeing tours and the best places to find italian cuisine. The rooms were immaculate and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathrooms were well supplied and offered many luxuries such as steam showers and great water pressure. Each night before we went out to dinner, Daniel or Luisa, prepared appetizers and a bottle of wine for a modest price that was served on the lovely patio outside of the hotel. The service was impeccable and we would highly recommend this hotel to any traveler. Our next trip to Rome would not be complete without staying at the Palm Gallery Hotel to visit our new friends, Luisa and Daniel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: MarkGD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days and it was delightful hotel. Small, more like a guest house, and about 5-6 k's from the city centre (short bus trip to the main bus terminal at SIlvestro). The room was very homely, well appointed, clean and modern, though with a warm and friendly atmosphere. The staff were outstanding - always smiling and helpful, and treated us like friends rather than guests. Breakfast was a bit limited but that relates more to the size of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the most amazing experience ..highlight of your honeymoon trip”
Reviews.Author: KayJee
Reviews.Content: we stayed at palm gallery hotel on our honeymoon trip between 30th december to 1st jan. luisa and her husband giancarlo are an extraordinary couple and run this hotel with so much of passion and make feel at home. Alll the staff, was most helpful and were always ready to assist with restaurant recommendations or any tips about rome. This is a small hotel with a lot of character .. Each room decor is different and has high quality toiletries from l'occitaine. What really impressed was the way everyone hen out of their way when my wife was sick. I would never stay anywhere else when in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel that made you feel like you were home!”
Reviews.Author: lady599
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palm Gallery hotel for a week in Nov. Luisa and her staff were very attentive, friendly, and helpful. We needed to be picked up at 12:30a.m. from the airport ,and they were able to accommodate us. Our room was very clean, nicely decorated, and well appointed. We had a corner room which was very nice. Breakfast each morning was a treat with fresh products from the area. The price of this hotel is very reasonable with breakfast and internet included. The staff helped us with directions and dinner recommendations. The hotel is located close to the subway system. It is a 10-15min walk, but the subway system can get you to anywhere you want to go in Rome. I truly can't say enough wonderful things about the hotel, Luisa and her staff. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: 3kidsGenolier
Reviews.Content: We have only great memories of this excellent hotel in Rome. Luisa, the owner, is such a friendly and kind person. She warmly received us, and my three kids just love her. She gave them coloring pages, markers, bought them pencils, chocolates...and we got fresh fruit in the room, flowers, slippers, L'Occitane products...The room was super clean, and fully renovated. The breakfast was delicious. Thanks Luisa for everything, we will be back (we threw so many coins at la Fontana di Trevi)!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, personalised service in a clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiburon17
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the night but Luisa and her husband were already waiting for us. They welcomed us with a big, warm smile and helped us with the luggages up the steps. We were given rooms from the 1st to the 3rd floor (we had booked for 9 bedrooms). After settling us down, she prepared hot drinks as well as delicious bioscotti, prepared by a nearby bakery. Before we retired for the day, Luisa asked us if we may have any special request for next morning's breakfast. Rooms were spacious, clean and the beds were comfortable. It was a well-rested night of rest, greeted with freshly-squeezed orange juice, pastry as well as eggs - personally prepared by Luisa, based on your preference. Though it was only a one-night stay, we felt like we were home, away from home. The sign, of the hotel, is abit too small and you may miss it while driving along the road. Other than that, would recommend Pam Gallery as your accomodation of choice when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “So welcoming- they treat you like family!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_and_Evan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited The Palm Gallery Hotel last June and were beyond impressed with Luisa and her staff! In every way, they went above and beyond to ensure our stay was comfortable and that we had everything we needed. It was like we were part of her family when Luisa welcomed us into her home. Daniel and Ahmed were always kind and helpful. The room was clean, good sized, and beautifully decorated. Great value for an unforgettable stay. We can't wait to return!!! "Nomentana!" :)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dankopko
Reviews.Content: Luisa and her staff are wonderful, always going above and beyond!!!! Will always return to Palm Gallery for the most comfortable stay when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyNick
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in a location that's close enough but far enough from the heart of the city. Comfortable rooms and an incredibly helpful owner and staff made the sightseeing and dining options very rewarding. Great value for money in one of the worlds great cities. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A first rate place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DavexChester
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Our hostess Luisa is an excellent example of how to run a hotel. We where welcomed at the door on arrival, and made to feel at home immediately. The location is out of the centre and you must walk to the buses\metro, however this is not a problem if you are reasionably fit. Luisa has a file of locations and directions for local restaurants and the sights. This is just one example of the care taken to ensure a good visit. Nothing is a problem at Palm Gallery, if you want something different at breakfast just ask. Tip, the hotel offers a shuttle to the airport, strongly reccommend you use this option.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Thomos
Reviews.Content: Words can not describe how much we enjoyed our stay at the Palm Gallery. Luise and Daniel made us very welcome and were especially kind to our two children. Nothing was too difficult for them to do for us. Breakfast was great, service even better and loved the rooms. The kids were also made to feel welcome and really enjoyed playing with the pet cats, dog and turtles. Cucciola was a favourite. After travelling around for a month it was great to relax in Rome - we spent a few mornings just sitting in the garden and drinking coffee. I would recommend this hotel to everyone - we will definitely stay there again if we stayed in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Corilow
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had the pleasure of staying at the Palm Gallery Hotel in October. From the moment we arrived at the train station, where Giancarlo, one of the owners, promptly picked us up and drove us to the hotel, it was pure heaven. Upon arrival, Giancarlo showed us to our room on the first floor. It was a cozy room with a queen bed and a nicely appointed bathroom, including, as others have mentioned, L'Occitane products. The bed was very comfortable, which was a welcome change from the hotel where we had stayed the previous 7 days in Sant Agnello on the Sorrentine Coast. The room was nicely decorated, too, and one could definitely tell that care went in to the decor, not only in the room, but throughout the entire place. We did not have the pleasure of meeting Luisa, Giancarlos wife and other owner, but I had several e-mail contacts with her and she is such a gem. She even reserved a table three weeks in advance of our arrival at a restaurant that we wanted to try in the Garbatella neighborhood of Rome (anyone an Anthony Bourdain fan?? We ate at the place featured in his "Rome" show, called Il Timoniere-the BEST carbonara ever). We were very sorry not to meet her in person. After dinner at Il Timoniere, we went back to the hotel, where Giancarlo served us a wonderful bottle of sparkling reisling and joined us on the terrace for a long conversation. What a lovely host. You definitley feel like family when there. We even met his lovely daughter, Marcella. If you are looking for a quiet neighborhood, a charming hotel, and an incredible staff, this is THE place to stay. It is easily accessible to the center of Rome via bus or metro. We took the metro, which was only a ten minute walk (Policlinico stop). Also, the breakfast is quiet good, with cheeses, meats, pastries, and yogurts. Of course, the coffee is great!! The best part, for those who do not like to rise too early when on vacation, is that the breakfast lasts until noon. One last point is that both of us are travel buffs, and have been all over the world. We have stayed in Rome before in 4 and 5 star places. This is definitely the best. Next time in Rome, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, personal service!”
Reviews.Author: Colin7887
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Rome, staying at the Palm Gallery Hotel. The service was excellent and very personal. We felt really welcome and relaxed here. The pick up and transfer we very professional and the welcome coffee/tea and treats inastanly made us feel at home. The rooms very of a high standard and the buffet breakfast was lovely, complimented with local pastries, meats and of course cheeses! We would highly recommend this as a high quality boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel with a soul”
Reviews.Author: Sid_singapore_78
Reviews.Content: What do you want from your hotel when you are on trip ? Well, for us it is lots of comfort (for the little time that we would be at the hotel),some help with finding directions, a convenient location and above all sincerity on the part of the management. These were all there at the Palm Gallery hotel in Rome. We stayed there for 4 nights, and it was a wonderful experience in every way. Like the best family run hotels, it was homely and cosy. The room was clean. The neighborhood was great . There was a beautiful reading balcony, where one could choose to unwind with a book after a hectic day. For those who reach termini station, to reach the hotel take bus no. 38 (buy the ticket from the newspaper stand) and drop off at the 8th stop, then you need to walk a bit (just take a map of Rome from the airport or termini station). But, I am not writing this review and praising the hotel for all these. Another good hotel would provide you the same or similar. On the day we left , it was early in the morning (a little before 5 AM) and when we went down the staircase, we found the owner, whose name is Luisa, waiting for us with breakfast. For that single act of kindness (and sincerity) and human decency, every time I go back to Rome , and I will (since I threw a coin at the Fontana de Trevi :)), I hope to go back to the Palm Gallery Hotel. Don't worry. Stay there, and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: jennifer_jones1228
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Palm Gallery for a long weekend. We enjoyed are stay very much! Luisa and her staff go out of thier way to make you feel welcome, provide you directions to and from sites and restaurants, and make your stay as enjoyable as possible. We were very thankful that they encouraged us to check out some fantastic places near the hotel which provided us with a snapshot of true Roman culture and lifestyle. I highly recommend that you stay at the Palm Gallery if you are looking for a personalized boutique hotel with excellent service and charm.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull family-like boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: rwsly
Reviews.Content: We thought we would try this hotel after reading all the great reviews on trip advisor. We were not disappointed !We've always stayed in large chain hotels. What a difference! The warmth and attentiveness of the staff was absolutely outstanding. They couldn't do enough for you. When we were there, Louisa was away. We met her the last night we were there and she was just as I imagined. What a warm and friendly person! In her absence was Daniel, her assistant. I can't say enough about this wonderful young man. What an asset for the hotel to have him! The level of personal service was awesome.. Going the extra mile for clients seems to be standard operating procedure for this hotel. Location is in a quiet neighborhhood. Public bus is about 15 minutes walk. the atmosphere at the hotel is very warm and family like. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Hoped For...And MUCH More!”
Reviews.Author: robharvey
Reviews.Content: If you're traveling to Rome and are looking for a boutique bed and breakfast,with amazing service, among other things, you've just found it w/The Palm Gallery. Whether it we're talking the room, the location, the neighborhood, the service...or Luisa herself (the proprietor)...the Palm Gallery is THE place to stay. Need a detailed map of the neighborhood, done. Need dinner at 2am after a late flight, handled. Need a driver to/from anywhere in Rome...booked. Need your new wedding ring brought back to you in New York City (after leaving it in your hotel room...oops!)....DONE! Many thanks to Luisa and her staff. We had an amazing stay. See you next time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: CDV27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palm Gallery for six nights in mid-October and absolutely loved the stay. All staff was exceptional-always providing excellent advice and suggestions with a smile and wonderful attitude. We traveled with our daughter, and they put special and cute towels for her every day. And when we left, Luisa (the warmer person I know) gave her a Italian chocolate. The hotel is in a peaceful residential and quiet area, with excellent and lovely restaurants (We loved: Pepe Verde) and easy access to public transportation (bus). Absolutely fantastic ....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with personal care from owner”
Reviews.Author: weazie256
Reviews.Content: From a recommendation from someone on Trip Advisor, I booked this hotel. It currently has 10 room and is privately owned. Rooms were reasonable, clean and the owner put herself out to answer questions and share information about the City. A little off the beaten path, but a very pleasant experience. They also will pick you up at the airport and we were going on a cruise and we were taken to the ship, for a charge of course, but the convenience was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: Bhaffner
Reviews.Content: Like many reviewers before me we really enjoyed our stay. Palm Gallery is very focused on the customer. Located in a great neighborhood, but access to plenty of public transportation. If we are lucky to enough to be back in Rome, we will stay at the Palm Gallery Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Rome hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Jean1058
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 nights at the Palm Gallery in September, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The hotel is very comfortable, quiet and relaxing, and in some ways feels like you're staying at the very beautiful home of friends. Luisa was away for much of my stay, but Daniel and the rest of the staff took excellent care of me. I slept so well here - in my opinion due to the comfortable bed, quiet neighborhood and overall good atmosphere of the hotel. I also enjoyed many relaxing evenings on the patio with a glass of wine and conversation with other hotel guests. I have stayed in many hotels in Rome, large and small, central and a little out of the way, and I will go back to Palm Gallery on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience and impeccable service...fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Tia4141
Reviews.Content: This is truly one of the best places i have ever stayed and i have travelled extensively. On our arrival we were greeted by Luisa who immediately catered for our requests, offering options of places to eat along with a local map. We were shown to our room which was a lovely size with walk in wardrobe, jacuzzi shower, lovely big towels, dressing gowns and slippers along with toiletries. We were offered hot drinks on our return each evening which was a lovely touch. I had a problem working the shower the following morning and Luisa had it solved within 15 minutes (how many places offer that level of service?) Our bed sheets were changed every day and the bed was amazing, i actually loved it more than my own bed at home! The hotel is in a beautiful location in a quiet area of Rome, which was perfect as i cannot imagine anything worse than the hum of traffic all night. We went to some lovely restaurants in the area and felt so at home as Luisa truly treats everyone with respect and warmth. The breakfast was amazing, so much to choose from, you could never be hungry. Beautiful croissants, pastries, cheeses, fresh bread, yoghurts and a plentiful supply of fruit. There was even a further fruit bowl out on the decking that had a wide range of fruit. If you want to stay somewhere relaxing, welcoming, quiet and special; Palm gallery is perfect. We thank Luisa for everything she did for us to make our stay a truly memorable one and i was very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff....Great Breakfast....Super Clean”
Reviews.Author: ryanbrown93
Reviews.Content: Near the end of a long vacation my wife and I stayed at the Palm Gallery and what a breath of frest air. This hotel was excatly what we needed. The staff was more then accomadating to our every need and want. Everything from directions, to dinner recommendations, shopping, and any thing else one could ever dream of a staff helping with!!! My wife is to say the least a neat freak and this lived up to even her crazy standards and beyond. The hotel although not downtown, the local bus could have you downtown in ten minutes.....The local dining was some of the best in our lives from a local fine dining seafood just steps from the hotel, to the best steak (and buffalo mozza balls)we have ever had. During our three week voyage of Europe we could easily say thanks to the staff at the Palm Gallery the most relaxing and enjoyable few days we have ever had on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location after all.”
Reviews.Author: marniebeau
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights. It is quite far from the tourist sights and though there is a bus not too far away, the first day it took us over an hour to find it with the map we were given. The bus was very crowded everytime we were on it and you are crushed in with other people, no chance of getting one of the few seats. Due to the location itself we would not stay there again. There are some restaurants within close walking distance that are just fine. The room was fine, very clean with an excellent shower. Breakfast was adequate - we do like cheeze and that's mostly what they have. There is also proscuito, yogurt, juice, coffee. There were soft drinks and ice at the bottom of the stairs for guest use. Noise was an issue the first morning - construction with drilling etc., but we didn't notice it after that much. The bed was hard but not uncomfortable and the linens were nice. What was missing, which we expected based on the previous reviews on this site was the friendliness and personal attention. We rarely saw Luisa. Nobody ever asked us how we were doing or if we needed anything, we had to ask to have our shampoo renewed. The other staff were polite, but not warm, and there were always more of them at breakfast than there needed to be in the small space. On one occasion I went down to ask a question and was ignored by Luisa for at least 20 minutes even though it was obvious I was right there and needed some help. I don't know how this place got a rank of #16 out of 1287 hotels in Rome. In summary, it wasn't bad, but we have had more friendly experiences even at big chain hotels. The owners have potential to do much better and I wish them well.

Reviews.Title: “Not yet another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Markmuc
Reviews.Content: The Palm Gallery is the wrong place if you're looking for a American-style 5-Star hotel in Rome. It's not in the center - but quite conveniently located in a very nice quarter North-East. The house, a 100-year old villa, is still under reconstruction but you shouldn't worry about this. Rooms are nicely and decorated in a mixture of modern style with Arab and African elements. Each room is unique. Some details are not perfect (our shower suddenly turned water from warm to hot). But the service is very warm and friendly, and the breakfast buffet is great. Definitively a good choice for travellers seeking for a charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: meganmoyle
Reviews.Content: A lovely welcoming hotel. Louisa and her staff couldn't do enough to make our stay a memorable one. Easy access to the metro to see the sights, great deck to sit in the evening with a bottle of wine. Very clean, attractive room and the hotel is situated in a quiet, leafy suburban street.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrekker97
Reviews.Content: Located some distance from the city sights, bus use is required, but is quite straightforward. The area is nice with some restaurants nearby. The owner is helpful & can give sketch maps to help choose the buses or restaurants. The noise created by the staff & ongoing modifications prevents any relaxed lie-in, with the thin walls & doors making it worse & the breakfast is nothing to look forward to, being the least i have ever seen, unless you like cheese, a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Wait until it's finished!”
Reviews.Author: Madkopite
Reviews.Content: Strange place. Nice friendly owner. Rooms clean but shower heads on the Jacuzzi shower were dirty. Tiling in bathroom not finished. Large walk in cupboard was our "dressing room". Breakfast even stranger. Very little to eat! Fruit bowl was not replenished while we were there. Room noisy at night due to staff using store cupboards outside our room. Doors very flimsy so noise travels within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely area”
Reviews.Author: Cfvarley
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really lovely and in a peaceful residential area. We decided to walk everywhere to make up for the amount we ate everyday in Rome. It took us about 30-40 minutes to walk from the hotel into the main parts of town but the walk was safe and scenic and if you go through Villa Borghese its fantastic and takes you to some great views over Rome. The staff at the hotel were all great, friendly and helpful and the airport pick up really took all stress away. The rooms at the hotel are very pretty and extremely clean and we felt really comfortable and valued which you don't always get at bigger and chain hotels. We loved the continental breakfast and the outside decked area where you could sit and enjoy a coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette85
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early September. We loved this hotel or should I say home. Luisa and all her wonderful staff and beautiful pets so welcoming. We did not want to leave. It was the start of our six week adventure of Italy and France. We could easily have spent longer at Palm Gallery. We stayed at wonderful accomodation throughout our trip but Palm Gallery topped them all. I would highly recommend this beautiful villa to all. I certainly hope to return. The location in the beautiful neighbourhood is perfect, felt very much part of the Italian suburb. Also within easy reach of transport and the magnificent city of Rome. Would thoroughly recommend the restaurant Osteriadell 'Arco, another wonderful experience and easy walking distance from Palm Gallery.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Michele6819
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying in the lovely Palm Gallery Hotel during our recent honeymoon in Italy. Unfortunately we stayed only one night, but felt compelled to write a recommendation as we thought the hotel was a great find, and a lovely alternative to other potentially “boring” or typical hotels. Even though the hotel is located relatively close to many of the major attractions, you feel like you are out of the hustle bustle of the city, which to us was a big plus. Rome can be over-stimulating, and to have such a peaceful abode to come home to at the end of the night is a wonderful thing. There are a multitude of plants in the front garden that lend a country-esque feel to the hotel, and the hotel owners did an incredible job of setting up lounge spaces throughout the hotel (there is a front deck area with a bunch of lounge chairs and umbrellas as well as a reading room and a lovely breakfast area with comfy arm chairs). There is an abundance of hotel staff to answer any questions (or refill your espresso cup!), and they even provide airport pick up and drop off services. We had the good fortune of being driven to the airport by Daniel (hope I am spelling his name correctly); Daniel was very professional and accommodating, got us to the airport lickety-split and all the while, engaged us with interesting conversation. All in all, we had a lovely time, and hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice B&B with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: leesoul
Reviews.Content: Husband and I enjoyed our stay here. Room was spacious and the staff was very service oriented and helpful. We think it was a very good value for the price. Location worked well for grabbing the bus and walking to sights. They had internet, drinks, and lots of helpful tips on getting around. Liked the shower and loved the bath products. Only negatives were bed wasn't super comfortable (two twins pushed together that weren't exact same height) and towels were the roughest I've encountered. That being said, I would still stay here again and recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “a bazaar little place”
Reviews.Author: celestekb
Reviews.Content: I don't really know where to begin with this review... we showed up and the person who greeted us didn't appear to speak italian or english. he gave us the impression they didn't have our reservation. after i showed him the confirmation email, our reservation was found, we were shown to our room. when we came back down for the typical welcome/map review/instructions for public transport/etc, no one could be found. we went off to see sights. we came back and the owner told us we had been upgraded to a different room for that night, but the next two nights of our reserved stay, our room we had booked was very small and so he had made other accommodations for us at a different hotel. so weird. we were happy to go to the other hotel. we can only assume our room was actually still under construction - not complete enough for us to stay. our 'upgraded' room: had very nice features/details, but was not complete. There were three extra plumbing fixtures (the pipes) showing in our bedroom and bathroom - just hanging out of the wall. the window in the bathroom only had one hinge, so it couldn't be opened/closed without fear that the huge thing would fall off. the rooms had no sound proofing... and the doors used a skeleton key which made me nervous. other people had amazing recommendations - i'm not sure what happened with our stay, but it definitely fell through the cracks. It seems that the owners have good intentions and are nice people, but their hotel isn't ready physically and the staff is not organized or properly trained.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this Hotel when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Yarramar
Reviews.Content: We spent our first 4 nights in Rome at Palm Gallery hotel. The hotel is just as the reviews have stated. Staying at the hotel feels more like staying with family or friends.The owners are warm, friendly and nothing is too much trouble.The service is excellent, the rooms clean and the atmosphere is welcoming making the trip back to the hotel after a day of sightseeing something to look forward to. Whilst the hotel is out of the main tourist areas the busses are efficient and close by making the journey to the centre quick and easy. A big advantage is that the shopping and restaurants nearby cater to mainly locals thus prices are reasonable as is quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian_Tapu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Palm Gallery Hotel over the week-end. Everything, from the bed linen till the patio cats was great! The Hotel is not located in the main touristic area, but the neighborhood is a really quite and relaxing one with a few cozt restaurants and coffee shops. The service was great, the rooms are clean and furnished in the most comfortable possible way. If you don`t enjiy the classic italian espresso, you can always have a big american coffee with lots of milk on the terrace :) If I must say something bad, it would probably be the airplanes which fly quite low over the area, but I guess this applies to all Rome. Overall, this is a really nice place to stay if you`re looking for something quite where you can feel like home.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at before!”
Reviews.Author: our2cents
Reviews.Content: I can’t say enough good things about the Palm Gallery Hotel. From the second we arrived the staff blew us away with their amazing customer service – Tony and Daniel are absolutely wonderful! We had room S4 (a “panoramic room”) and loved it. All of the finishing’s were brand new, tons of space, large windows and a great bathroom. The beds were comfortable and the hotel is very quiet. Breakfast was great with a lot of fresh pastries and cheeses (and many other items). Some other reviewers commented on the location, but I really loved that it wasn’t in the heart of the tourist area. It’s a very short bus/metro ride from the busy area so it made it very relaxing to come back after a long day of sightseeing to a nice quiet area. The restaurants in the area are filled with locals so you really get the real “Rome experience” in my opinion. I felt very safe in the hotel because the area seems to be mainly higher end residents. Without a doubt I’d recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: Jacksmum63
Reviews.Content: The good; nice big room with high ceiling, nice furniture, small but bright shower room, good location. The not so good; terrible sound insulation (we could hear the people in the next room using their toilet and the front door buzzer reverberates around the whole building), very poor breakfast in terms of the selection and amount of food available, the staff need training (the TV was more interesting than the guests) - with the exception of the manager who did his best. I was expecting a comfy boutique hotel but they have a lot of work to do to address some very serious noise problems which blighted our stay. Having said that I wish them well as the building and the garden is a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling Homesick for Rome”
Reviews.Author: manakea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a vacation in Rome and Spain. When we left Rome and the Palm Gallery Hotel for Spain I felt homesick. When we booked our 4 nights we did so on the recommendation of all the great comments we read on Trip Advisor. Please be advised, comments are not too good to be true. They are spot on and the Palm Gallery is truly a special place! Your experience there will be so personal and memorable. They have ten guest rooms but, the attention you receive is so over the top you feel as if you are their only guests. Other guests that we met there were also very pleasant and friendly. You feel like a family! The guest rooms are nicely appointed, clean and like everything else personalized with Luisa's special touches. I was so sad at first to learn that Luisa was not going to be present while we were there, but she assured me that we would be in good hands with her husband Giancarlo, Daniel, Tony, Farouk and the rest of the breakfast staff. She was right! They took such good care of us. What a great team! The restaurant suggestions were great - especially liked walking to Pepe Verde and passing the fountain after a nice meal and a quiet stroll through the neighborhood. Giancarlo even got us information of a nearby catacomb and a ride there in his personal car. Thank you Tony for going out of your way to try and retrieve a lost jogger. You are right Daniel...do not leave without ID or hotel information. Now what hotel have you ever stayed at with this kind of personalized service? It was genuine and from the heart. Loved all the pets too! This was our third trip to Rome and by far the BEST, mainly because of our stay at the Palm Gallery. We have always thrown our three coins into Fontana di Trevi to ensure our return to Rome. We will be back and the Palm Gallery will be our home while we are there! We must come back to meet Luisa! You have a remarkable home/hotel, keep up the outstanding service! Baci - Palm Gallery Hotel!! XOXO

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service - a gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: LawStoke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of those places that you don't want to rave about so that it stays a secret hidden gem. On the other hand the place was so amazing that it deserves a great review. First of all the staff will do anything to help your stay to be a fab as possible. It’s a nice change to see breakfast served until 12 noon too! Even if you miss breakfast the staff are quick to offer you free pastries/coffee/water. This in itself is a nice change to the usual 4 euros per bottle from most hotel mini bars! The place is situated in a beautiful residential area so no noise from tourists or traffic. There is a gorgeous park just up the road and also some fab restaurants right on your doorstep if you don't fancy venturing into the tourist area of Rome. The place is situated 1.3 miles from the Spanish Steps but I think this is as the crow flies. When walking there it took a good hour on foot. But we didn't mind this at all as you pass numerous fab cafes, buildings and even the remainder of the old roman walls as you head to the main sights. It was great weather so a lovely walk and we felt we needed it after taking advantage of the amazing pasta on offer at the local Villa Paganini restaurant. The hotel is a recently refurbished villa and no expense has been spared. Our room was amazing - fab authentic furniture which must have cost a fortune alone! Our en-suite bathroom had a wonderful jacuzzi shower with jets coming out wherever you wanted! The best shower I've ever had to be honest with plenty of hot water. This place is the perfect mix of authentic Italian accommodation mixed with luxurious mod cons. Soft bed linen and fresh towels everyday. Plus the place was absolutely spotless. There's clean but this place was amazingly clean. A true pleasure to stay here and we would recommend it without hesitation. The owner was on hols but in her absence the staff were so friendly and couldn't do enough for us. It sounds a little corny but it was as easy to sit and chat with them (the outside terrace was lovely) like we'd known then ages! I understand that by this time next year they also hope to have installed a lift and a cafe type place downstairs. There are also plans for an outside jacuzzi - this place is gorgeous but has plans to become even more fab! We would definitely return. The only small thing that has stopped me from giving this place top marks is that unfortunately our room was right next to the neighbouring room so it was quite noisy if someone was arriving or leaving (or if the room was being cleaned). But this was only for a few minutes usually and so although we had broken sleep most mornings we simply nodded back off to sleep and took advantage of the hospitality later! We weren't even cross when we were woken up - the place is just so beautiful. Well done Luisa and staff for adding to our amazing time in Rome! x

Reviews.Title: “I love the Palm Gallery! Would stay again and again...”
Reviews.Author: Jgarruto
Reviews.Content: I’ve been to Rome several times prior to my last trip staying in very expensive hotels, but I would have to say staying at the Palm Gallery was the most enjoyable, delightful and wonderful experience I have had. Only a 15-20 minute stroll to the metro station –the Palm Gallery was a welcomed peaceful escape away from all the noise and chaos of the center city. I traveled through Italy with my two daughters, where Daniel and Louisa were so accommodating and made their first experience in Rome, truly remarkable. The rooms were large, very comfortable and air conditioned, (much appreciated in 95 degree heat), and the staff was so accommodating it was truly like staying with family. Traveling with two teenage girls can be a challenge, however the hotel was perfect for all three of us – free wifi available in the rooms or lobby, lovely breakfast included every morning, and recommendations for local restaurants and places to go off the beaten path. Another incredible aspect of the Palm Gallery was that the rates were ½ the rate of staying anywhere more near the center of town. I would not hesitate to stay here any and every time I travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A JEWEL OF A HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn_Salvatore
Reviews.Content: A UNIQUE hotel - both in staff and location. Luisa, the owner, is a warm, genuine person who truly goes out of her way to welcome you and offers excellent suggestions for restaurants and/or sightseeing (ask her about "Lemoncocco"). Although she is very humble about it, her proficiency in English is excellent. The building itself is very elegant, and although still undergoing renovation, we can imagine how spectacular this place will be when it is completed. It will merit not 5, but "6" stars. We absolutely loved the neighborhood with grand residential buildings, parks and gardens. Luisa pays very close attention to details, and it is evident in the room amenities such as fresh flowers, L'Occitane toiletries, an abundance of nice thick towels in the washroom, furniture with ample storage, comfortable beds and pillows and above all - a nice quiet air conditioner that you can program with a remote control. The breakfast choices are in abundance and very fresh. We went back for more. Luisa's pets are also precious - her dog, cats and 2 turtles - they are all part of the wonderful experience and we just loved them. Her Assistant Manager, Daniel, is a sweet, personable young man who gives very courteous service and is an excellent driver (he took us to the airport in a very comfortable van). In conclusion, we were very sad to leave Rome. This is a city you fall in love with slowly, and when you do - it is for life! We will return to Rome. We will return to the Palm Gallery. THANKS LUISA!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Amelia2
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of the Palm Galley Hotel and making a reservation, my husband and I wondered if something was going on - it sounded too good to be true. It turned out to be even better than we thought. We stayed at the Palm Galley for four nights in late June with our two kids, ages 10 and 12. It was the perfect place to stay in Rome: quiet residential neighborhood away from the tourist areas, clean, quiet and cool rooms, pretty garden, good breakfasts with great cappuccino, and, of course, the kind, hospitable and energetic Luisa. Despite having an amazing amount to do, Luisa always took time to talk to us and thoughtfully answer our questions. She seemed to delight in kids, telling our boys stories, putting out special towels for them and, on our last night, leaving them large chocolate eggs with prizes inside on their pillows. The kids loved staying there and playing with her dog, her cats and her two free roaming turtles in the garden. In fact, when a relative asked one of my kids what his favorite part of our three week trip to Italy was, he answered the Palm Galley Hotel and Rosalba and Hugo (the turtles). My only concern for the Palm Gallery Hotel is that Luisa not get overwhelmed and lose the enjoyment she seems to have in her guests and the hotel. She has ambitious plans. When we were there she was having a lift installed, she had just bought a van so the hotel could transport guests, and she had plans to put in a restaurant. It seems like a lot - although she just may have the energy to pull it off. To summarize, I wish I could give this hotel more than five stars. It was one of our favorites of all time. If we return to Rome, we wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect clean and causy hotel to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rogilboa
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in the hotel and loved every moment. The rooms are clean, equiped with everything one needs. Louisa and the stuff were polite nice worm and helpful. I will highly recomrnd thus hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HONEYMOON GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: Stirling48
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I may have the honour of having the longest stay at the Palm Gallery. We spent the entire two weeks of our honeymoon being spoiled by Luisa and her wonderful staff. We had a spacious corner room, beautifully decorated. We were amazed at the choices for breakfast on our first morning in Rome. Luisa was always available to call us a cab (All cabs arrived in minutes and we preferred this to the bus as it was very hot). After days spent exploring the city, we would relax on the patio, visiting with Luisa and the other guests. We sampled many wines and learned a little about each from Luisa or her husband. Drinks were always accompanied by delicious snacks. Luisa is an expert shopper and shares her shopping tips! We had booked a bus tour to Naples and Pompeii, needing to be at the bus station early. Luisa got up early to make sure we were up, providing us with water and food for the journey. This hotel feels like home. We loved the beautiful garden, the dog, the turtles and of course . . .the cats. We were given the priviledge of naming a kittnen born during our stay. Be sure to say hi to tiny orange Chiisai for us and tell him/her we will be back to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wil come back”
Reviews.Author: drpetr
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults+3 kids ages 14,12,9) spent 3 nights in Rome. We travel a lot and recognize value where there is one. We need a friendly, quiet and comfortable place to sleep, hosts who treat us like a family. We got that with the owners (Luisa and Giancarlo) and their super friendly staff. The rooms we had were clean with all the amenities necessary. The breakfast was just right. We are type of travelers who come to a city to explore it, not to lazy around in our room or hope for opulent, "all you can eat" meals. We enjoyed relaxing on the patio after a long day. Chatting with the owner's family and other guests on a warm summer night made the experience of visiting Rome complete. We hope to visit them in the years come again.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing and friendly sanctuary away from the hoards of tourists”
Reviews.Author: Thenewduffys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palm Gallery as part of our honeymoon in late August. We really loved the hotel. It is modern, clean and run by a friendly staff who are very happy to help out with anything you need. Breakfast and drinks are served on a lovely decked outdoor terrace. We loved coming back to the hotel after a busy day visiting the sights of Rome and it was like a little sanctuary away from the tourists and hustle and bustle. Luisa and her team were also good at recommending restaurants which were very much the opposite the tourist traps in the city centre. It may feel a little out of the way (it is about 20 minutes out of the centre and based in a residential area) but we felt this was very much a plus. There is a metro station about 10 minute walk away so easy to get into the centre or you can get a taxi from the hotel which is generally there within minutes. If you like chic, boutique hotels with a personal service then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay of our entire Holiday”
Reviews.Author: marjorieanncapel
Reviews.Content: My two children and I travelled around Europe in May 2010 and Palm Gallery Hotel was undoubtedly the best hotel experience we had between the 5 different cities we were at. We stayed for a duration of 3 nights in a Triple Room with one Double Bed and a Single. We hardly had any trouble looking for the hotel, even if it were a slight walk from the nearest train station. Upon arriving, we were very warmly greeted by Daniel, the assistant Manager, who showed us to the room with a hot cup of coffee and advice about the nearest eateries. There is a lovely pizza restaurant in a park near the hotel, serving quality wood-fired pizzas. The rooms are impeccably clean, the beds very comfortable, and the toilet was spacious and clean as well - there were even L'Occitane products for us. The size of the room was remarkably big too, considering the size of rooms at other hotels in Rome. The breakfast was a substantial spread of pastries, fruits, cheese, youghurt and bread. What was amazing too was that the staff even prepared fruit-smoothies for my children at breakfast, catered to their personal preference. Advice about tourist attractions were not just verbal, but even included peronalised maps printed with buses that directed us to and fro from the hotel. As you may have read from the other reviews about the owner of the hotel, Luisa - she is indeed all that they have said about her. A very hospitable lady who took a personal interest in all her guests' comfort, spending time to talk about Rome and learning about where we came from. In particular, there are two events that speaks volumes about the attention and service excellence at this hotel. Firstly, as we had booked late for this hotel, we were only able to book the hotel for 3 nights, instead of the 4 that we were spending in Rome(as Palm Gallery was full on the last night). Luisa offered to help us find a room for our last night without our asking, such that we could go around Rome without having to worry about finding an accomodation for the last night. Secondly, when we were to move to the next hotel after our last night, the assistant Manager, Daniel, offered us a ride to our next hotel even though it was out of his way driving to the airport at no charge at all. The experience at Palm Gallery is definitely worth or even exceeds the amount you pay for it. If you are visiting Rome and there is room available at this hotel, I am confident you will be pleased with quality of both the rooms and service at Palm Gallery. We searched high and low on tripadvisor too when searching for a hotel, afraid that we could not trust reviews - but really, you won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The best part of my trip”
Reviews.Author: brightpurl
Reviews.Content: After trudging around Italy in the scorching heat and relentless crowds for two weeks, my friend and I finally landed at the Palm Gallery Hotel. What a gem! The hotel is a converted villa in a quiet residential neighborhood, but just a hop, skip, and a jump away from the sights of Rome. To be honest, I was so tired by the time I arrived it was just a relief to stay around the hotel, and even more of a relief to come back to the hotel after finally making myself see a few more ruins and museums. The owner, Luisa, is a charming and warm world-traveler, striking up conversations and checking on everyone's well-being. This is a family-run operation, and we also met Luisa's husband and one daughter, who were also super nice and helpful. The hotel is charming and extremely tasteful, bright, and airy with gorgeous art, rugs, linens, and furniture. The room we had was spacious and immaculate, and though it was already immaculate, the hotel staff cleaned the room thoroughly every single day. The room was absolutely sound-proof and air conditioned with a lovely view of trees. The included breakfast was also the most delicious we had among many B & B's, with pastries from the best local bakery, slices of Italian salame, cheeses, tomato and mozzarella salad, a big hunk of fresh bread, fruit, yogurt, and made-to-order cappucini. Yum!! The couple of days we had to leave before breakfast, we were a bit depressed. Have no fear of the location! It was super easy either to walk or to catch the bus (#62?) to any sight--literally 10 minutes. I grew to love that bus, as it takes you along the Corso, and even drops you off right at the foot of the Vatican--for only 1 euro! Also, this location puts you in close proximity to local restaurants where actual Italians eat--such a relief after a slew of bad meals aimed at tourists. Our favorite was La Limonaia, an outdoor pizzeria (wood-fired oven) that serves about 400 Italians every single night--yum!!! We actually didn't try any of Luisa's other recommended restaurants because it was too hot to eat formal meals, and because we wanted to try everything on the menu at La Limonaia. I can't wait to go back to Palm Gallery!

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome in the Capital”
Reviews.Author: HectorsHouseCumbria
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during the August UK Bank Holiday, and specifically did not want an anonymous city centre hotel. Getting there was so easy...direct train from the airport to Terminii, then 2 stops along metro B or a bus to Via Nomentura and a 3 minute walk. On arrival we enjoyed a bottle of prosecca on the terrace. So quiet & relaxing after the bustle of the city only 10 minutes away by bus. Our room was spotless with nice towels & toiletries, hairdryer, dressing table for SWMBO, flatscreen TV, fridge & safe etc. PG is in a quiet residential area with several good local restaurants. Only visit the nearby fish restaurant if you have lots of money! It was the most expensive meal of my life and not worth the expense. Luisa provides walking maps showing routes around local places of interest, and is more than happy to chat & give advice on any aspect of your visit to Rome. The Roma Pass is well worth buying. If we ever return, we should be happy to stay here again. A wonderful change to large 4* city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in hectic Rome”
Reviews.Author: David189894
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for a few nights after a weeklong stay in Florence. When we arrived with our 3 months old son at Palm Gallery Hotel, we had a hot and cramped train ride behind us. It really felt like arriving at an oasis in the desssert when we were served cold drinks and presented with a very cosy room. When we booked our stay we told the owner, Luisa, that we would be traveling with a baby. Instead of telling us that the hotel did not usually have babies as guests, she asked us what we needed in order to be comfortable. When we arrived she had prepared a crib with pillow and linnen, a plastic tub for the baby to take a bath, a stroller to walk around town (since we did not bring one for this part of the trip) and so on. We were overwelmed by the hospitality and commitment to make our stay enjoyable. We also got all our questíons about were to eat and what to see answered with a smile. All in all we are very happy with our stay and would recomend anyone to stay at Palm Gallery Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dani-Mandler
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by searching tripadvisor and we enjoyed every moment. This is exactly the place you want to have after wandering and touring Rome for a whole day and returnig in the middle of the hot summer sweating and tired. Luisa and her stuff try to make the place as comfortable as possible. The rooms are incredibly clean and pleasant and sitting in the balcony and getting tips from Luisa together with wine and coffee are absolutely wonderful. It's was really a feeling of staying at home and we would definitely return to "our home" in Rome in the future. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, live like the Romans.”
Reviews.Author: deepcover
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Palm Gallery Hotel for a week and enjoyed it very much. The room was lovely, furnished in a tropical style, and everything was brand new so the bathroom and the air conditioning worked perfectly. Luisa and Daniel and the staff were very charming and helpful. Luisa is a lovely, mothering type of lady and Daniel is smart and knowledgeable. The breakfasts were delicious and it was so nice to have the friendly cats and dog around. All in all, we really enjoyed ourselves. I would mention that the hotel is in a residential neighbourhood and far away from the tourist attractions, so you need to take a taxi or bus to get anywhere. There are many nice restaurants in walking distance of the hotel for dinner. I would describe the place as more like a bed and breakfast or a pensionne than a hotel, it's more informal and home-like than a regular hotel. The furnishings are first class though. Also, there is a slight degree of disorganization which is not enough to be a problem, but you may want to double check things. For example, we had arranged for a drive to the airport but the van was not there at the prearranged time, so a taxi was called instead and we got there in time but it caused a little panic. Rome in general seems to be slightly disorganized, so you just have to roll with it.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the city”
Reviews.Author: GraysHarbor
Reviews.Content: Returning to our cool, clean, friendly hotel may have been the highlight of our 5 days spent in the blistering heat of July in Rome. I don't normally post online comments one way or the other, but a positive review here is really the least I can do to say THANK YOU to Luisa and her staff for all they did to make us feel comfortable during our stay. The Palm Gallery Hotel really is as good as all the reviewers have stated. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hosts, superb rooms, superb service - stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: tomsmith93
Reviews.Content: Being a much travelled 61 year old teacher, I think I know what makes a great hotel and the Palm Gallery comes up trumps in all criteria. From the moment we were picked up by Daniel, Louisa's right hand man, to the moment we were dropped off by her husband it was the most delightful of stays. Nothing was too much trouble - from serving breakfast at 1.00pm after a particularly late night to giving expert tourist advice (including booking a restaurant which served up one of the best seafood meals we have had in ages) to continually trying to ensure that we wanted for nothing. If in Rome,do yourself a favour and stay here - we. will certainly go back. Tom and Val Smith, Singapore

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: jesshamilton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palm Gallery Hotel for 3 nights. Louisa is the most amazing host, the hotel is beautiful, the rooms are lovely all newly decorated, great airconditioning and comfortable beds. The area is so quiet and peaceful, easily accessible to the City centre 10 mins by Taxi. Daniel met us at the airport, Daniel was so obliging and very knowledgeable, the staff are very discreet. Upon arrival at the hotel we had a beautiful bottle of champagne and some nibbles whilst relaxing on the balcony. Little did we know that this was to be our favourite spot in the garden, relaxing and chatting with Louisa who helped to plan our travels by car into Tuscany via Porta San Stefano!!! (a Nav Man is a must). We highly reccomend this hotel and can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful room I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: gert79
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights at the Palm Gallery Hotel. Our room was absolutely beautiful and comfortable. Luisa was a very sweet hostess and was always helpful. One of our employees, Daniel, was wonderful too. I wish I remembered the names of other staff members as they were all so kind to us. Luisa's husband, John Carlo, picked us up at Termini Station and we knew we had chosen the right place to stay, even before we arrived on site. The location was ideal, in a beautiful residential neighborhood in proximity to a beautiful park. We did not take a taxi during the entire length of our stay as the bus lines and the train station were within walking distance. I'm not surprised with the wonderful reviews this hotel has received. As Luisa explained to us, they designed the hotel with amenities that they, themselves, enjoy as travelers. They did everything right. We would not consider staying anywhere else on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully decorated, comfortable, hospitable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abbynormal007
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by how well this hotel was designed and decorated. We had four rooms for four nights and everyone was reported a very good experience. Luisa was so helpful and hospitable, she recommended places to eat, visit and even met us at the train station when we arrived. Her staff is professional, friendly and eager to help. The hotel has a nice "smoking room", which we used to just sit and talk when it wasn't occupied by smokers. Also, there is a beautiful rooftop patio that wasn't complete yet when we stayed, but when it is complete, it looks like it will be amazing. The hotel has a little cafe area where Luisa and er staff can whip up alcoholic beverages, smoothies, cappucino and little snacks. Also, be sure to enjoy the outside garden area if it's not too hot; relaxing place to sit and talk. The only complaint I have is that it could be difficult to achieve quiet or privacy sometimes. With the combination of occasional construction in the hotel and neighbor noises along with with thin room doors that do not insulate sound, quiet and privacy were usually hard to come by. The location is not really central to many attractions, although if you learn the bus and subway system, you can get anywhere you need without much walking. I recommend you learn this system early. The hotel was a little pricey, but considering the quality of rooms and amenities, I would say it is a very good value and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “made to feel most welcomed”
Reviews.Author: WVaPetunia
Reviews.Content: Luisa, Daniel and staff were extraordinary. Rooms were clean; nicely appointed and a good value. Villa lovingly in the final stages of restoration in quiet Trieste neighborhood 30 minute walk from Central Rome. Great place to enjoy Rome if you are a walker and get away from the hustle and bustle. Nice terrace for evening apero with many fine suggestions from Luisa for restaurants nearby. We were overwhelmingly pleased, recommend highly, and hope to return. Ask in advance for prices on laundry. We thought 50 Euro a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Was everything I could have asked for and so much more!”
Reviews.Author: livarivera
Reviews.Content: Me and my best friend stayed at Palm Gallery for two nights on 6/24/10. Coming from the states I have never experience service of this caliber. Louisa, Daniel and staff made us feel like we were at home from the moment we walked in. They welcomed us to sit and have a glass of wine on the veranda upon entering. They were so helpful in every way. The room was incredible and I've never slept on a more comfortable bed!
